content:

to manure a field―dress a garden―fertilize land
骨は好い肥やしになる
Bone makes a good fertilizer―fertilizes the soil―enriches the soil.

痩せ犬の腹を肥やせ(に相当するは)
“Feed the birds of the air and the beasts of the field.”

to enrich oneself―fill one's pocket―line one's purse―feather one's nest
口を肥やす
to pamper one's taste

content: 2. (=肥しをする、肥しになる)to manure (a field); to dress (a garden); to fertilize (land); to enrich (the soil)

Each man has his own individuality.

content:
ごよう〔御用〕
〈名〉
1. (=用事)your business; your orders; your commands

content.content: ご用は?
What are your commands?―Will you state your business?―Come to the point!
ほかにご用はありませんか
Have you any other orders?
私に何ご用ですか
What is your business with me?―What do you want with me?
何かご用ですか
Do you want anything with me?―Do you want me?―Can I do anything for you?
どういうご用ですか
What do you wish me to do?―What can I do for you?
お母様がご用
Mamma wants you.
お客間でご用
You are wanted in the parlour.
ご用の節は呼鈴をお鳴らし下さい
When you want me, please press the button.
それだけのことですか、おやすいご用です
Is that all? It's no trouble at all.
主人にご用なら私がお取次ぎ致します
If you have anything to say to my master, please leave it with me.
今ご用を伺います
I shall be at your service in a moment.
ご用の方は差配まで
Please inquire at the agency.

content: 2. (=公用)official business; government service; public service

content.content: 御用有之{ごようこれあり}、英国へ出張を命ぜらる
He has been ordered to England on official business.
彼はご用で旅行中
He is travelling on official business―in the service of the government―under government orders.
ご用(!)
I arrest you in the name of law―(英国では)―In the King's name!
いつなん時ご用と踏み込まれるかも知れぬ
A policeman may dash in at any moment and arrest me in the name of law.
ご用になる
to be arrested

content: 3. (=註文)an order (to a tradesman)

content.content: 今日はなんぞご用は
Have you any order (for me) today?
雑貨店からご用を聞きに参りました
The grocer has sent for orders―The grocer's man has come for orders.
多少にかかわらず、御用おおせつけられたく候
We beg you will favour us with your orders―We beg to be favoured with your orders―irrespective of their size.
宮内省ご用
Under the patronage of the Imperial Household.
宮内省ご用洋服商
Tailors to the Imperial Household.

ごよう〔誤用〕
〈名〉Misuse; misapplication:(=する) to misuse (a word); to misapply (a law, etc.)

a sheet-calendar―a wall-almanac

a block-calendar

こらい〔古来〕
〈副〉From time immemorial; time out of mind

content.content: これは古来の習慣である
It has been the custom time out of mind―from time immemorial.
この戦乱は古来その比を見ず
This war has no parallel in history.
人生七十古来稀なり
“Threescore and ten is the age of man,” and yet few have attained it.

content:

〈名〉Patience

content.content: おまえはこらえ情が無くて困る
You are too impatient.

content:
こらえる〔怺える〕
〈他動〉
1. (=我慢する)to bear (pain); to stand (heat or cold); to endure (pain); to put up with (poor fare); to brook, pocket, swallow, digest, stomach (an insult)

content.content: 痛いのをこらえる
to bear pain―endure pain
痛いのをじっとこらえた
I bore the pain firmly.
痛くとも黙ってこらえる
“Grin and bear it!”
こう暑くてはこらえられぬ
I can't stand the heat―The heat is intolerable―unendurable―unbearable―not to be borne―past bearing―beyond endurance.
失敬なことをされてもしかたが無いからこらえてきた
I pocketed the insult―swallowed the insult―(as best I might).
その失敬なと言ったらとてもこらえられなっかた
I could not stomach the insult―I could not brook the insult.
何もご馳走が無いからこらえてくれ給え
You must put up with poor fare.
学校に金が無いからこの待遇で当分こらえてくれ給え
You must put up with these terms for the present, as the school is short of funds.
僕はたいがいのことはこらえるが冷笑ばかりはこらえられぬ
I can stand anything in reason, but being sneered at.
さすがの僕もこればかりはこらえきれなかった
I could not stand this―This was too much for me.
腹が立つのをこらえかねて彼を殴った
I could not stand the provocation, and struck him―I was provoked into striking him.
いやでもこらえろ
“If you don't like it, you may lump it.”
いくら悟り開いた哲人でも歯の痛いのばかりはこらえられぬと見える
“A philosopher with a toothache” is a ridiculous sight.
人の痛いのは三年もこらえる
“Another man's burden is always light.”

content: 2. (=抑える)to control (one's passion); to repress, contain (one's anger); to suppress, stifle (one's laughter); to restrain (one's hunger or thirst); to keep down, choke down, gulp down (one's tears)

content.content: 腹が立つのをこらえる
to repress one's anger―contain one's anger―control one's passion
腹が立ってこらえられなかった
I could not contain my anger―could not control my passion―lost my self-control.
腹が立つのをぐっとこらえた
I repressed―bit my lips.
おかしいのを笑わずにこらえる
to suppress one's laughter―stifle one's laughter―keep from laughter―keep one's gravity―keep one's countenance
おかしくてこらえられなかった
I felt so tickled that I could not but laugh―I could not help laughing―I could not keep from laughter―I had much ado to keep my countenance.
おかしいのをどうかこうかこらえた
I managed to keep my gravity―keep my countenance.
その光景があまりおかしいので皆こらえきれずに笑い出した
The sight was so ludicrous that it upset our gravity.
泣きたいのこらえる
to keep down one's tears―choke down one's tears―gulp down one's tears―refrain from tears
泣きたくてこらえられなかった
I could not refrain from tears―I could not help crying―I could not help crying―I could not but cry.
泣きたいのをぐっとこらえた
I choked down my tears―gulped down my sobs.
眠くてこらえられなかった
I could not keep awake.
眠いのをどうかこうかこらえていた
I managed to keep awake―I struggled against sleepiness.
小便や大便をこらえる
to restrain the call of nature
彼は酒が飲みたいのを飲まずにこらえている
He restrains his thirst for liquor.

content: 3. (=堪忍する)to forgive (one a fault); to pardon (one for a fault); to spare (one trouble)

content.content: お腹立ちはごもっともですが、なにとぞ私に免じてこらえて上げて下さい
You have good reason to be angry, but please pardon him for my sake.
今度だけはこらえてやる
I will forgive you (your fault) for this once.
この恥をかかせることだけはこらえて下さい
Spare me this humiliation!
僕にこんな面倒をかけるのはこらえてくれてもよかりそうなものだに
They might have spared me spared me such trouble.

content: 〈自動〉(=我慢する)to contain oneself; to hold out

content.content: もうこらえられぬ
I can not contain myself any longer―I can hold out any longer.
さすがの判事もこらえかねて吹き出した
The judge himself could not contain himself and burst out laughing.

content:

〈名〉Amusement; entertainment; recreation; pastime; pleasure

僕は娯楽として音楽をやる

娯楽のために読書する

content.content: 一つこらしめてやりたい
I should like to teach him a lesson―teach him manners―give him a rap on the knuckles.
後日の誡めにこらしめてやろう
I will teach him a lesson as a warning for the future.
彼の失敗は好いこらしめだ

content.content: 工夫をこらす
to tax one's ingenuity―adapt the means to the end

考えをこらす
to rack one's brains―cudgel one's brains―beat one's brains
瞳をこらす
to strain one's eyes
瞳をこらしてやっと見える
You can just see it by straining your eyes.
学問に心をこらす
to concentrate one's mind on one's studies
意匠をこらす
to elaborate a design
なかなか趣向がこらしてある

こらし過ぎた意匠だ

熟議をこらす

密議をこらす
to hold secret consultations

〈自動〉

2. (=熱中する)to be fanatical; to be a fanatic; to be a zealot; to be a bigot; to be bigoted; to be absorbed in (study); to be engrossed in (one's profession); to be immersed in (business); to go heart and soul, into (a scheme)

content.content: 借金はもう懲り懲りだ

あまりいろいろのことに手を出すのは懲り懲りだ

子どもを遊ばしておいて懲り懲りしている親は世間にいくらもある

人の保証人に立つのは懲り懲りだ

相場に手を出すのは懲り懲りだ

酷い目に逢って懲り懲りした
I have learned by woeful experience.
戦争はもう懲り懲りだ
We have had enough of fighting.
あの男にはもう懲り懲りだ
I have had enough of that man.

ご料馬車
an Imperial carriage
ご料林
a crown forest
ご料地
an Imperial estate
ご料局
the Bureau of Imperial Estates

ごりょう〔御陵〕
〈名〉An Imperial mausoleum

ごりょうきょく〔御料局〕
〈名〉The Bureau of Imperial Estates

ごりょうち〔御料地〕
〈名〉An Imperial estate

ごりょうば〔御猟場〕
〈名〉An Imperial preserve

content:
こりる〔懲りる〕
〈自動〉To profit by experience; to learn by experience; to grow wiser by experience; to learn to one's sorrow; to know to one's cost; to find to one's cost; to learn a lesson; to repent of (anything); to have had enough of (war, etc.)

content.content: 彼は悪いことをして懲りている
He now repents of evil-doing.
借金には懲りている
I know to my cost what it is to be in debt.
あまりいろいろのことに手を出すのは懲りている
I have found to my cost what it is to have too many irons in the fire.
子どもを遊ばしておいて懲りている親は世間にいくらもある
Many a father has learned to his sorrow what it is to have his boy idle.
人の保証人に立つのは懲りた
I know by experience what it is to stand surety for others.
相場に手を出して懲りた
I have learned by experience what it is to dabble in speculation.
彼は賢くも一度の失敗に懲りて失敗を重ねない
He was so wise as to profit by experience.
失敗して懲りた
I have learned a lesson from my failure―I have grown wiser by experience.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 一度の失敗に懲りて二度と手を出さなかった
A single failure discouraged me from trying again.
一度の失敗に懲りるようでは何事にも成功することはできない
If you are daunted by a single failure, you can not succeed in anything.
これに懲りて将来こういうことをするな
Let this be a warning to you!
一つ殴られたら懲りるだろう
A thrashing will teach him to be careful.
なにとぞこれにお懲り無く
I hope to day's experience will not prevent your calling again.
羹{あつもの}に懲りて膾{なます}を吹く
“A burnt child dreads the fire.”

content:
ごりん〔五倫〕
〈名〉The five human relations (of parent and child, husband and wife, master and servant, brothers, and friends)

content.content: 五倫の道
the five cardinal articles of morality

content:
こる〔凝る〕
〈自動〉
1. (=肩などが凝る)to stiffen, grow stiff (with hyperemia)

content.content: 肩が凝る
to have stiff shoulders
書き物をして肩が凝った
Writing has stiffened my shoulders.

content: 2. (=熱中する)to devote oneself to (some work); to give oneself up to (some work); to addict oneself to (pleasure); to abandon oneself to (pleasure); to fling oneself into (books); to go, heart and soul, into (a scheme); to be absorbed in (study); to be engrossed in (one's profession); to be immersed in (politics); to have a passion for (some pursuits); to be bent on, be intent on (one's studies, etc.)

content.content: 彼は英語に凝っている
He is devoted to the study of English―absorbed in the study of English.
語学を修めるには凝らなけりゃ駄目だ
In order to master a language, one must give one's days and nights to its study and practice.
身体の弱い子どもは往々学問に凝る
A boy of weak constitution will often fling himself into books.
彼は学問に凝っている
He is absorbed in his studies.
学問に凝っているから余事を考えない
He is too intent on his studies to think of anything else.
専門に凝っている
He is engrossed in his profession.
商売に凝っている
He is immersed in his business.
彼は何事にも凝る質だ
He will go, heart and soul, into any scheme.
英国人は勝負事に凝る
The English have a passion for sporting.
彼は遊びに凝っている
He is addicted to pleasure―bent on pleasure.
人の凝っているもの
one's ruling passion
あの人は何に凝っているか
What is his ruling passion?
あの人の凝っているのは金儲けだ
Money-making is his ruling passion―He is bent on money-making―devoted to money-making―absorbed in money-making.

content: 3. (=意匠を凝らす)to elaborate; to give rein to fancy

content.content: 凝った意匠
an elaborate design
意匠が凝り過ぎている
The design is overwrought.
細工が凝っている
The workmanship is elaborate―It is of exquisite workmanship.
凝った柄だ
It is a fanciful pattern―a tasteful pattern.
凝った支度
a fanciful dress―a tasteful dress
凝った嗜好
exquisite taste
彼女の支度は非常に凝っている
She is dressed in exquisite taste.
彼の支度は凝り過ぎている
He is finically dressed.
凝った普請だ
It is a tasteful building―a sumptuous building.

content:
コルク
〈名〉→『

content.content: キルク

content:
これ
〈間投詞〉Here; look here; I say

content.content: これご覧
Look here!
これ何をする
Look here, what are you doing?
これ、権助、俺の下駄はどこにある
Here, Gonsuke!―(I) say, Gonsuke!―where are my clogs?
これさ待て待て
Hold! hold!
これ、よく聴け
Mind (you)!―Mark my words!

content:
これ〔是〕
〈指摘代名詞〉This(複数―these)

content.content: これはこれあれはあれ
This is distinct form that―This has nothing to do with that.
これはこれとして
Setting this apart,―Apart from this,...
これでもまだか
Take this! and this!
これはしたり
Bless my soul!―Good gracious!―Goodness gracious me!
これが即ち損して得取るということだ
This is what I call making the best of a bad bargain.
これでやっと安心した
This takes a weight off my mind―A weight is of my mind.
彼はいつもこれだ
This is his way.
あの人はこれだから困る
This is the trouble with him.
これも誰ゆえ貴方ゆえ
To whom do I owe all this but to you?
これ別人ならず王その人なりき
It was no less a personage than the king.
これなら来るのでなかったに
If I had known how it would be, I would not have come.
これでも日本人だ
I am a Japanese, such as I am.
これでも日本人か
Is this the conduct of a Japanese?―Do you still call yourself a Japanese?
これでも武士か
Are these the doings of a samurai?―Does he still call himself a samurai?
僕は別にこれという当てが無い
I have no particular aim.
別にこれという理由は無い
I have no particular reason.
彼はこれという著述が無い
He has no work to speak of.
これという功労は無い
He has rendered no services to speak of.
別にこれという道楽は無い
He has no particular hobby.
これぞという家が無い
I can find no house that will do.
これを以てこれを見れば彼の成功もそもそも故あるかな
In this view,―In view of these facts,―it is no wonder that he should succeed.
然るにこれに反して
While, on the contrary,...
あれやこれや
this and that―one thing and another
彼はあれやこれやでなかなか金を儲ける
He makes a good thing by this and that―by one thing and another―one way and another.
あれやこれやで手がふさがっている
My time is taken up with this and that―What with one thing, what with another, my time is wholly taken up.
あれやこれや思い合わせるとうに違い無いと思った
Putting this and that together,―Putting two and two together,―I concluded it to be so.

content:
これから〔是から〕
〈副〉
1. After this; hereafter; henceforth; in future; now; here:(=の) future

content.content: これからもっと勉強します
I will work harder after this―in future.
これからは慎みます
I will be more careful hereafter―for the future.
これからは酒を断ちます
I will abstain from wine henceforth―from this day forth.
これからだ
Here goes!
これから話が面白くなる
Now comes the cream of the story.
寒くなるのはこれからだ
Now begins the really cold time of the year.
これからが本文だ
Here begins the text.
これから始めよう
Let us begin now!
これから課業を勉強します
I will now go at my lesson.
これから先どうするつもりか
What are you going to do in future?
これからもあることだからご注意なさい
Such things may happen again in future, and I give you fair warning.
あの人はこれからだ
He is entering upon his career.
これからの人間は学問ばかりじゃ駄目だ
Men of the future must not be content with mere knowledge.

content: 2. (打消に伴えば)(not) any more

content.content: これからあんなところへ参りません
I will not go there any more―I will go there no more.
これから致しません
I will do so no more―I shall not repeat it.

content:
これぎり〔是切り〕
〈副〉
1. No more; never again; once for all

content.content: これきりあんなところへは行かない
I will go there no more―I will not go there any more.
これきりこの家には足踏みもせぬ
I will never set foot in this house again.
説明するのはこれきり
I will explain it once for all.

content: 2. This is all

content.content: これきりしか有りません
(量なら)This is all there is―(数なら)―These are all there are.
これきりですよ(もうあげないよ)
This is all you will have.
これきりの話だがあの人の言うことは当てにならぬ
Between ourselves, he is not to be relied upon.

content:
これくらい〔是位〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: これぐらい〔是位〕

content:
これぐらい〔是位〕
〈副〉This much; so much; so

content.content: これぐらいあったらたくさんだろう
I think so much will do.
いつもこれぐらいあればよい
This much will do every time.
これぐらい書けりゃたくさんだ
If you can write so well, it is enough.

content:
これこれ
〈間投詞〉Here; look here; I say

content.content: これこれ何をする
Look here! What are you doing?
これこれ、権助、俺の下駄はどこにあるる
Here, Gonsuke!―(I) say, Gonsuke!―Where are my clogs?

content:
これこれ〔是れ是れ〕
〈副〉So and so:(=の) such and such

content.content: これこれのわけがあってこれこれしたと言えばよい
You need only say you have done so and so for such and such a reason.

content:
これしき〔是式〕
〈形〉So slight; so trifling

content.content: これしきのこと
such a trifle
何のこれしきのこと
Oh! it is nothing.
これしきのことで立腹するな
Do not take offence at such trifles!
これしきのことで力を落としてはいかん
You must not lose heart over such trifles.
これしきのことと思う
to make light of a matter
彼は病気をこれしきのことと思っているうちに手後れになった
He made light of his illness till it was too late.
何のこれしきのことと言って彼は取合わない
He pooh-poohed the idea.

content:
これすなわち〔是即ち〕
〈熟語〉This is exactly what...

content.content: これ即ち損して得取るということだ
This is what I call making the best of a bad bargain.

content:
これぞという〔是ぞと云う〕
〈形〉(Anything) to speak of, worth mentioning; (anything) that will do

content.content: 彼はこれぞという著述が無い
He has no work to speak of.
これぞという功労は無い
He has rendered no services worth mentioning.
これぞという家が無い
I can find no house that will do.

content:
これだけ〔是丈〕
〈副〉
1. This much; thus much; so much

content.content: これだけは確かだ、彼はその日に不在であったということだけは
This much is certain―Thus much is certain―that he was away from home on the day in question.
その土手の高さは(仕方をしながらいう)これだけである
The bank is about so high―about thus high.
これだけ書けりゃたくさんだ
If you can write so well, it is enough.
(学校に金が無いから)これだけで辛抱してくれ給え
You must put up with this salary―these terms.
(金が無いから)これだけしか御返済することができません
I can only pay you this sum.

content: 2. This is all; this is the only (thing)

content.content: 僕の要る物はこれだけだ
This is the only thing I want―These are all the things I want.
有る金はこれだけだ
This is all the money I have.
僕が聞いたのはこれだけだ
This is all I have heard―This is the only thing I have heard.
私の申すことはこれだけです
This is all I must say―All I have to say is this.
彼ができるのはこれだけだ
This is the only thing he can do.
僕の財産はこれだけで
(もう無い)This is all my property―(ほかに無い)―This is my only property.
誤りはこれだけでない(まだある)
This is not the only mistake―These are not all the mistakes.

content:
これでも〔是でも〕
〈副〉［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: これでも日本人だ
I am a Japanese, such as I am.
これでも日本人か
Is this the conduct of a Japanese?―Do you still call yourself a Japanese?
これでも武士か
Are these the doings of a samurai?―Does he still call himself a samurai?
これでも博士か
Is this the work of a doctor?―Does he still call himself a doctor?

content:
これなり〔是なり〕
〈副〉As it is

content.content: このことはこれなりにしておこう
We will leave the matter as it is―We will drop the matter.

content:
こればかり〔是計り〕
〈形〉So small; so little; so scanty; so trifling; so paltry

content.content: こればかりの金で何ができるものか
What can one do with such a paltry sum?
こればかりの給料で暮らせるものか
How can I live on such scanty pay?―live on such a pittance?
君はこればかりの月給でよく満足しているね
How can you content yourself with such a small salary?
こればかりの物を貰ったとて返礼をするのには及ぶまい
I need not give anything in return for such a trifling gift.

content:
〈副〉
1. This is all; this is the only (thing)

content.content: 有る金はこればかり
This is all the money I have.
僕の聞いたのはこればかり
This is all I have heard―This is the only thing I have heard.
僕の要る本はこればかり
This is the only book I want―These are all the books I want.
あるものはこればかり
This is the only thing I have―These are all I have.
彼ができるのはこればかり
This is the only thing he can do.

content: 2. (Anything) but this

content.content: 何でも致しますがこればかりは
I will do anything but this.
何でも上げますがこればかりは
I will give you anything but this.

content:
これはこれは〔是は是は〕
〈間投詞〉Oh!

content.content: これはこれはようこそ
Oh! I am glad to see you.

これはしたり〔是はしたり〕
〈間投詞〉Bless my soul!; Good gracious!; Goodness gracious me!

content:
これほど〔是程〕
〈副〉
1. So much; so

content.content: 英語がこれほどむつかしいものとは思わなかった
I did not think English was so difficult.
英語を教えるのがこれほど骨が折れるものとは知らなかった
I did not know that it was such hard work to teach English.
これほどよく書けりゃたくさんだ
If you can write so well, it is enough.

content: 2. (打消に伴えば)more

content.content: これほど面白い旅行をしたことが無い
I never enjoyed a journey so much―(慣用法にては)―I never enjoyed a trip more.
これほど好きなことは無い
I like nothing so well―(慣用法にては)―I like nothing better.
これほど面白い思いをしたことが無い
I never had so pleasant an experience―(慣用方にては)―I never had a more pleasant experience
これほど面白い芝居を見たことが無い
I never saw so amusing a play―(慣用法に手は)―I never saw a more amusing play.

content: 3. (=これほど何々して)for all this...

content.content: これほど照っても水が切れない
Water does not fail for all this sunshine.
これほど降っても洪水にならない
There is no flood for all this rainfall.
これほど説明してもまだ解らないか
Do you not understand for all my explanation?
これほどお願いしてもお聴きいれがありませんか
Will you not listen to all my entreaties?
これほど言ってもまだ分からないか
Has all my talk been in vain?

content:
これまで〔是迄〕
〈副〉
1. Hitherto; heretofore; till now; so far; thus far; up to date; down to date

content.content: これまでに知れた事実はこれだけだ
These are all the facts that have been ascertained up to date―down to date.
これまでは万事好都合でした
So far, all has gone well―Thus far, all has gone well.
これまではよろしい
So far, so good.
これまでは私立学校に通っておりました
I have hitherto attended a private school.［注意］通例 “hitherto,” “till now” の意味を継続の perfect Tense を以て表す。
君はこれまで何をしていましたか
What have you been doing (till now)?―How have you been engaged (till now)?
これまで雑誌編輯の助手をしておりました
I have been assisting in editing a magazine (till now).

content:
2. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 君はこれまで(この久しい間)どこに居たのか
Where have you been all this while?
今日はこれまでにしておこう
That'll do for today.
これまで見たうちでこれが一番だ
This is the best I ever saw.
僕はこれまでずいぶん偉い人を見たがこんな偉い人は初めてだ
I have seen great men in my time, but I never set eyes on such a man.
僕はこれまでずいぶん芝居を見たがこんな面白い芝居は初めてだ
I have seen many plays in my time, but I never saw such an amusing play.
これまでに無いできだ
You have outdone yourself―eclipsed yourself.
これまでのことは水に流してしまおう
What has happened, shall be buried in oblivion.
これはこれまでに無い事件だ
This is an unprecedented case.
これまでに育て上げるのは並みたいていの苦労じゃありません
It cost me no common trouble to bring him up to what he is.
もはやこれまでだ
It is all over with us―It is all up with us―All is over―All is up―The game is up―All is lost―We are lost.
船が水雷を喰らった時はもはやこれまでなりと覚悟した
When the ship was torpedoed, I gave myself up for lost.
彼は今はこれまでと自害した
He gave up all hope, and committed suicide.

content:
これみよがしに〔是見よがしに〕
〈副〉Ostentatiously; showily; flauntingly; for parade; for display; to show off

content.content: 彼はこれ見よがしに支度している
He is ostentatiously dressed―showily dressed―He flaunts his fineries.
彼はこれ見よがしに学問を誇示する
He parades his learning―makes a parade of his learning―makes a display of his learning.
成金はこれ見よがしに金を使う
Upstart millionaires spend their money to show off.

content:
これよりさき〔是より先〕
〈副〉Before this; prior to this ［注意］英語にては通例 Past Perfect をもってこの意をあらわす。

content.content: これより先、仏国に兵乱ありたり
There had been a war in France.

content:
これら〔虎列刺<コレラ>〕
〈名〉Cholera

content.content: コレラ発生す
Cholera breaks out.
コレラ流行す
Cholera prevails―Cholera is prevalent.
コレラ流行地
a Cholera-infested district―a cholera-stricken district
コレラ猖獗を極む
Cholera is rife―Cholera is rampant.
コレラが蔓延する
Cholera spreads.
コレラ病あり
Infected with cholera.
コレラにかかる
to be attacked with cholera
コレラにかかった者が三名ある
There are three cases of cholera.
コレラにかかると死ぬ者が多い
Many people die of cholera―Many cases of cholera prove fatal.
コレラにかかって倒れる
to die of cholera―succumb to cholera―fall a prey to cholera
コレラに倒れる者何千
Thousands fell preys to cholera―Cholera carried off thousands.
コレラ予防注射をする
to make a preventive injection against cholera
コレラ予防注射液
anti-cholera serum
コレラを撲滅する
to stamp out cholera
真性コレラ
asiatic cholera―malignant cholera
疑似コレラ
false cholera
軽症コレラ
cholerine
コレラ菌
cholera-vibrio―the comma bacillus

content:
これら〔虎列刺<コレラ>〕
〈名〉Cholera

content.content: コレラ発生す
Cholera breaks out.
コレラ流行す
Cholera prevails―Cholera is prevalent.
コレラ流行地
a Cholera-infested district―a cholera-stricken district
コレラ猖獗を極む
Cholera is rife―Cholera is rampant.
コレラが蔓延する
Cholera spreads.
コレラ病あり
Infected with cholera.
コレラにかかる
to be attacked with cholera
コレラにかかった者が三名ある
There are three cases of cholera.
コレラにかかると死ぬ者が多い
Many people die of cholera―Many cases of cholera prove fatal.
コレラにかかって倒れる
to die of cholera―succumb to cholera―fall a prey to cholera
コレラに倒れる者何千
Thousands fell preys to cholera―Cholera carried off thousands.
コレラ予防注射をする
to make a preventive injection against cholera
コレラ予防注射液
anti-cholera serum
コレラを撲滅する
to stamp out cholera
真性コレラ
asiatic cholera―malignant cholera
疑似コレラ
false cholera
軽症コレラ
cholerine
コレラ菌
cholera-vibrio―the comma bacillus

これをもってこれをみれば

content:
これをもってこれをみれば〔是を以て之を見れば〕
〈熟語〉In view of this fact; in this view

content.content: 是を以て之を見れば彼の成功は抑々故ある哉
In this view, it is no great wonder that he should succeed.

content:
ころ〔頃〕
〈名〉
1. Time

content.content: あの頃は電車が無かった
There were no electric cars at that time―in those days―then.
あの頃とは世の中が違う
The times have changed since then.
君が帰る頃には僕は東京を去っている
I shall have left town by the time you return.
昨日の今頃着いた
I arrived about this time yesterday.
彼は今頃京都に着いたろう
He must have reached Kyoto by this (time).
毎年今頃は荒れる
The weather is always stormy at this time of the year.
今頃この夜ふけに彼はどこへ行くのかしら
Where can he be going at this time of night?
頃は
It was...
頃は天保十二年
It was the 12th year of Tenpo.
頃は弥生の末つ方
It was the end of the month of March.
いつ頃
When?
それはいつ頃の出来事か
When did it happen?
あの人はいつ頃行ったら在宅だろうか
When shall I find him at home?
君はいつ頃から悪いのか
(Since when―と言わずして)How long have you been ill?―How long is it since you fell ill?―When did you fall ill?
君はいつ頃までここに居るか
(Till when―と言わずして)How long shall you stay here?

content: 〈前置詞相当〉About; towards

content.content: 明日は六時頃発つ
I leave (at) about six tomorrow morning.
十日頃に帰る
I shall be back (on) about the 10th.
彼が米国から帰るのは八月頃だろう
He will return form America (in) about August.
夜明け頃
towards daylight
日暮れ頃
towards nightfall
十九世紀の終わり頃であった

content:

〈他動〉
1. To kill; to slay; to put (one) to death; to take one's life:(謀殺する)to murder:(屠殺する)to butcher (one in cold blood):(虐殺する)to massacre, slaughter (the inhabitants):(暗殺する)to assassinate:(かたづける)to despatch:(ばらす)to make away with (one who stands in the way):(往生させる)to do the business for (one); to do job for (one); to do for (one); to send (one) to one's long account; to launch (one) into eternity:(息の音を止める)to put an end to one's life; to make on end of one's life

content.content: 人を殺す
to kill a man―murder a man―commit murder―dip one's hands in blood―imbrue one's hands in blood
あの男は人を殺したことがある
He has killed his man.
我が子を手にかけて殺す
to kill one's child with one's own hand
寸鉄人を殺す

天道人を殺さず
“All is for the best”―“God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb.”
殺さずに命を助ける
to spare one's life
降参する者は殺さず
Those who surrender will be spared their lives.
殺すも生かすもこの方寸にある
It rests with me to kill or spare him―He is in my power―He is at my mercy―His life is in my hands.
妾身任君殺
My life is thine to kill or spare―
妾身任君活
It rests will thee to spare or kill,
妾身有亜郎
There is a man to my heart dear―
妾心不可奪
My heart's not time to win at will.
人を殺そうとする
to make an attempt on one's life―seek one's life―plot one's death―plot against one's life
殺さば殺せ
I defy you.
彼らは人を殺すことを何とも思わぬ
They make nothing of murder―They have no regard for human life―They are hardened to crime.
彼は人を殺して死刑になった
He was hanged for murder.

content: 〈以下特例〉

小の虫を殺して大の虫を助ける
to sacrifice the few for the sake of many―Death to the criminal is mercy to the people
虫も殺さないような顔をしている
He looks as innocent as a lamb―She looks as if butter would not melt in her mouth.
猫を殺せば七代祟る
“A cat had nine lives.”
角を矯めて牛を殺す
“The remedy is worse than the evil.”

content:

〈形〉［注意］この形容詞には主観、客観の両意あり。
1. ［主観的］(=恐れる)to fear, be afraid of (thunder); to be frightened at, be scared at (one's appearance); to dread (earthquakes); to be terrified at (a catastrophe); to be horrified at (a disease); to stand in awe of (a great man)

content.content: あの犬が怖い
I fear that dog―I am afraid of that dog.
雷が怖いか
Are you afraid of the thunder?
僕は地震が怖い
I dread earthquakes.
親父が怖い
I stand in awe of my father.
火事は怖くない
I have no fear of fires.
何が一番に怖いか
What is your greatest dread?
地震が一番に怖い
Earthquakes are my greatest dread.
あんな奴なに怖いものか
Why should I fear him?
その男の様子が怖かった
I was frightened at his appearance.
実に怖かった
I had such a fright―had such a scare.
おー怖い
How dreadful!
怖くて震える

怖くて縮まる

怖くてものも言えなかった
I could not speak for very fear―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Fear deprived me of my power of speech.
彼らは怖いから命に従うのだ
The obey from fear.
罰が怖いから命に従うのだ

content: 2. ［客観的］(=恐るべき)fearful (thunder); frightful (face); dreadful (monster); terrible (earthquake); horrible (disease); awful (fate); grim (face); grisly (countenance); uncanny (story); weird (tale, etc.)

content.content: 怖い話

to have a dreadful experience―have a fright―get a horrid scare
地震で怖い思いをした
The earthquake gave me a dreadful experience―gave me a horrid scare.
ばかほど怖いものは無い
Nothing is more to be dreaded than a fool―A fool does not know what he is doing.

When he praises you to your face, he has some end in view―he has an axe to grind.

こわす〔毀す〕
〈他動〉To break (a cup); to break down (one's health); to destroy (a bridge); to demolish (a statue); to smash (a kite); to wreck (an aeroplane); to take down, pull down, tear down (a house); to get (a watch) out of order

content.content: 誰が窓をこわしたか
Who has broken the window?
何でもこわしたら弁償させる
If you break anything, you must make good the loss.
茶碗をこわす
to break a cup
茶碗をこわしてついでみたって始まらない
It is no use crying over spilt milk.
家をこわす
to demolish a house―take down a house―pull down a house―tear down a house
古い家をこわして新築する
The old house will be pulled down, and a new one built in its place.
泥棒が窓をこわして入った
The burglar broke in through the window.
民衆は垣をこわして中へ入った
The populace broke through the fence.
鍵が無いから箱をこわして明けた
As there was no key, we broke the box open.
戸をこわして明けた
The door was broken open.
時計をこわした
I have got my watch out of order.
時計の機械をこわしてみる
to take a watch to pieces
腹をこわした
I have got my bowels out of order―My bowels are out of order.
暴食して腹をこわした
Excessive eating has disordered my stomach.
身体をこわす
to break down one's health―ruin one's health―break down one's constitution―undermine one's constitution―shatter one's constitution―make oneself ill
酒を飲むと身体をこわす
Wine will undermine your constitution.
君は飲み過ぎるから身体をこわすのだ
You make yourself ill by drinking too much―You drink yourself ill.
あまり勉強して身体をこわしては困る
You must not make yourself ill by working too hard―You must not work yourself ill.
彼は身体をこわして帰って来た
He has returned in broken health―with a broken constitution―with a shattered constitution.
あまり菓子を食ってさんざんに胃をこわした
Too much confectionary has worked havoc with my stomach―played the devil with my digestion.
せっかくまとまりかけた縁談を下手をやってこわしてしまった
The match, which was all but arranged, was broken off through want of tact.
一組の物をこわす(半端にする)
to break a set
金をこわす(細かにする)
to change money
あの工場が建って風景をこわした
That factory has spoiled the scenery.

こわそもいかに〔こはそも如何に〕
〈間投詞〉And lo!; and behold!

こわだかに〔声高に〕
〈副〉In a loud voice; loudly

content:
こわたり〔古渡り〕
〈形〉Imported of old

content.content: 古渡りの珊瑚
coral brought by the Portuguese

こわっぱ〔小童〕
〈名〉A stripling; a youngster

こわね〔声音〕
〈名〉(One's) voice, tone of voice

content:
こわばる〔硬張る〕
〈他動〉To stiffen; to become stiff

content.content: 着物は糊をつけてこわばっている
My gown is stiff with starch.
靴が雨に当たってこわばった
My boots have become stiff through exposure to the rain―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The rain has stiffened my boots.

こわめし〔硬飯〕
〈名〉Glutinous rice steamed with red beans

content:
こわもて〔怖持て〕
〈名〉Being courted through fear

content.content: 新聞記者はこわもてにもてる
Newspaper men are courted through fear―They make themselves feared.
君は職業柄こわもてがするのだ
The nature of your business makes you feared by people.

こわらしい〔怖らしい〕
〈形〉Frightful (face); grim (face); grisly (countenance); ghastly (face); horrid (old man); hideous (grimace, etc.)

content:
こわれ〔毀れ〕
〈名〉
1. Breakage

content.content: こわれ物
a fragile article
こわれ椅子
a crazy chair―a rickety chair

content: 2. (=破片)a fragment

content.content: 瀬戸物のこわれ
fragments of crockery―broken china

content:
こわれもの〔毀れ物〕
〈名〉A fragile article

content.content: こわれ物注意
“Fragile: to be handled with care.”

こわれやすい〔毀れ易い〕
〈形〉Fragile (article, etc.)

content:
こわれる〔毀れる〕
〈自動〉To break; to be broken; to be damaged; to be smashed; to be wrecked:(時計なら) to get out of order:(家なら) to go out of repair; to go to rack and ruin

content.content: ランプがこわれた
The lamp is broken.
こわれたランプ
a broken lamp
こわれた茶碗
a broken tea-cup
こわれた茶碗をついでみる(に相当するは)
to cry over spilt milk
時計がこわれた
My watch is out of order.
時計がこわれたから直しにやってある
My watch is being repaired―at the watch-maker's.
飛行機がこわれた
The aeroplane is wrecked.
飛行機が墜落してめちゃめちゃにこわれた
The aeroplane, falling to the ground, was smashed to pieces.
家は修繕が行届いてこわれておらぬ
The house is in good repair―kept in good repair.
家は修繕をしないからこわれている
The house is out of repair.
ひどくこわれている
The house is very much out of repair―in very bad repair.
修繕しないからこわれてしまうばかりだ
The house is going to rack and ruin for want of repairs.
嵐のために家がこわれた
The storm has damaged the house―done damage to the house.
嵐のために塀がこわれた
The storm has breached the wall.
垣根がこわれている
There are breaches in the fence.
機関がこわれた
The engine has broken down.

content:
こん〔根〕
〈名〉
1. (=根気)perseverance; persistence; staying power; mental energy; stamina; vim

content.content: あの人は根が好い
He has stamina―indefatigable perseverance.
今時の若い者は根が無い
Modern youth are wanting in perseverance―Young men nowadays lack staying power.
根限り働く
to work with all one's might―strain every nerve
根が尽きた
My energy is exhausted.
この食物は根の薬だ
The food gives energy.
根比べする
to see which can hold out longest―play the waiting game
今の戦争は根比べだ
Modern warfare is a waiting game.
根負けする
to be out-persevered―be the first to give in (in a waiting game)
君には根負けする
You out-persevere me―You tire me out.
人は運鈍根の三つが揃わなければ何事にも成功することができぬ
Perseverance, luck and stolidity are the three essential factors of success.

content: 2. (=数学の根)a root; a radical

content.content: 平方根
a square root
立方根
a cubic root

content: 3. (=化学の根)a radical

こん〔紺〕
〈名〉A dark blue:(=の) dark blue; navy-blue

content.content: 紺に染める
to dye cloth a dark blue
紺羅紗
blue cloth―navy-blue cloth
紺は藍より出でて藍より青し
The pupil outdoes his master―The son outshines his father―The daughter eclipses her mother.

content:
こんい〔懇意〕
〈形〉Intimate, familiar (with some one)

content.content: 彼とは懇意にしています
I am on intimate terms with him―on familiar terms with him.
二人は非常に懇意な仲だ
They are hand and glove with each other―They are as thick as thieves.
彼とどうして懇意になったか
How came you to be so intimate with him?
人と懇意になる
to strike up an intimacy with one―get acquainted with one―make acquaintance with one
ふとしたことから懇意になった
We became acquainted by chance―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Chance made us acquainted.
なにとぞご懇意に願います
I beg you will favour me with your friendship―(片苦しい、普通は)―I should like to know you better―I hope you will know me better.

こんいろ〔紺色〕
〈名〉A deep blue; a dark blue

content:
こんいん〔婚姻〕
〈名〉Marriage; matrimony; wedlock; union:(=する) to marry (a man or a woman); to be married (to a man or a woman); to be united (with a man or a woman)

content.content: 婚姻式
a marriage ceremony―a wedding―nuptials
婚姻式を挙げる
to solemnize a marriage ceremony―celebrate a wedding

こんか〔渾家〕
〈名〉The whole family; all the family

content:
こんかい〔今回〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: こんど〔今度〕

content:
こんかぎり〔根限り〕
〈名〉With all one's might; to the utmost of one's power

content.content: 根限り働く
to work with all one's might―exert oneself to the utmost―strain every nerve

こんがすり〔紺飛白〕
〈名〉Blue cloth with white splashes

content:
こんがらかる
〈自動〉(Ropes) get entangled; (thread) gets ravelled; (matters) get complicated; (ideas) get confused

content.content: 糸がこんがらかって解けない
The thread has got hopelessly ravelled.
ずいぶんこんがらかった事件だ
It is a pretty complicated affair.
彼は頭がこんがらかっている
His ideas are confused.
彼の言うことはこんがらかっている
His statement is in a tangle.
話がこんがらかった
I have made a mess of my story―lost the thread of my story.

content:
こんがり
〈副〉(To be roasted) brown

content.content: 魚はこんがり焼けたのが好い
I like fish done up brown.

content:
こんがん〔懇願〕
〈名〉Entreaty; solicitation; supplication:(=する) to entreat (one to do something); to solicit (a favour―one for something); to supplicate (one for something); to implore (one to do something); to beseech (one to do something)

content.content: 伯(叔)父に懇願して外国に連れて行って貰った
I entreated my uncle to take me abroad.
再三懇願して許可を得た
I obtained the permission after repeated entreaties.
懇願を容れる
to listen to one's entreaties
彼は僕の懇願を容れなかった
He turned a deaf ear to my entreaties―He was deaf to entreaty.

content:
こんき〔婚期〕
〈名〉Marriageable age:(=の) marriageable

content.content: あの人は婚期の娘がある
He has a marriageable daughter.
彼女はもう婚期だ
She is of a marriageable age.
まだ婚期でない
She is not yet of marriageable age.
もう婚期を過ぎている
She is past her marriageable age.

こんき〔根基〕
〈名〉［化学］A radical

content:
こんき〔根気〕
〈名〉Perseverance; persistence; staying power; mental energy; stamina; vim

content.content: 根気が無くては何事も成功はできない
One can not succeed in anything without perseverance―without an untiring energy.
彼は根気が好い
He has stamina―indefatigable perseverance.
今時の若い者は根気が無い
Modern youth are wanting in perseverance―Young men nowadays lack staying power.
根気を詰める
to persevere―persist
根気好く働く
He perseveres in his work―persists in his work.
彼は根気好く待っている
He perseveres in waiting―persists in waiting.
根気好く幾度もやってみた
I tried again and again with persistence―I persisted in trying.
彼は根気好く勉強する
He plods away at his work―grubs away at his work―drives away at his work―pegs away at his work.
根気が尽きた
My energy is exhausted.
彼は根気が尽きて倒れた
He has given out.
根気比べする
to see which can hold out longer―play the waiting game
今の戦争は根気比べだ
Modern warfare is a waiting game.
根気負けする
to be out-persevered―be the first to give in (in a waiting game)
根気で人を負かす
to out-persevere a man―tire one out
君の根気に負けた
I must give in to your perseverance―You have tired me out.

content:
こんぎ〔婚儀〕
〈名〉A marriage ceremony; a wedding; nuptials

content.content: 婚儀を行う
to celebrate a wedding―solemnize a marriage ceremony

content:
こんきまけ〔根気負け〕
〈名〉Being out-persevered:(=する) to be out-persevered; to be tired out; to be the first to give in (in a waiting game)

content.content: 君に根気負けした
You have tired me out―You have out-persevered me―I must give in to your perseverance.

content:
こんきゃく〔困却〕
〈名〉Perplexity; embarrassment; trouble:(=する) to be perplexed; to be embarrassed; to be in trouble; to be at a loss; to be at one's wits' end; to be in a fix; to be in a dilemma; to be hard put to it

content.content: どう処置してよいか困却している
I am at a loss how to act―I am perplexed.
問題の解決に困却している
I am at a loss for a solution of the problem.
金が無くて困却している
I am embarrassed for funds―pressed for money―hard up.
百万手を尽してもその効が無く実に困却している
I have tried every means in vain, and I am at my wits' end.
金を使い果たして困却している
I have spent all my money, and I am in a fix.
この金を取れば大罪、取らなけりゃ滅亡、実に困却した
If take the money, I shall commit a crime; if I do not, I shall be ruined―I am in a dilemma.
彼は一家を養うのに困却している
He is hard put to it to support his family.

content:
こんきゅう〔困窮〕
〈名〉Poverty; need; want; destitution; distress; straits; straitened circumstances:(=する) to be poor; to be reduced to poverty; to be destitute; to be in need; to be in want; to be in distress; to be in straits; to be in straitened circumstances; to be badly off:(=せる) poor, needy, necessitous, destitute, distressed (family, etc.)

content.content: 彼は困窮の極みに達している
He is in abject poverty―in the utmost need―in the utmost want―in extreme distress―in the utmost straits―in utter destitution.
ロシア人の困窮の状、目も当てられぬ
The Russians are in the direst need.

content:
こんきょ〔根拠〕
〈名〉The base (of operations); the basis (of morality); the grounds (of one's argument); the foundation (of Christian faith); authority (for one's statement)

content.content: 根拠有る
(議論なら)a well-grounded argument―(説なら)―an authentic statement.
根拠の無い
(議論なら)an ill-grounded argument―(風説なら)―an unfounded rumour―a groundless rumour―(説なら)―a mythical statement―(道徳なら)―a baseless morality
この風説は根拠が無い
There is no foundation for the rumour―no ground for the rumour―The rumour is unfounded―groundless.
僕の疑念に立派な根拠がある
My suspicions are well grounded.
その議論は根拠が堅い、根拠が弱い
The argument is well-grounded―ill-grounded.
君の議論の根拠は薄弱だ
The grounds of your argument are flimsy.
その学説は根拠が無い
The theory is baseless.
その報道は根拠がある、根拠が無い
The report is authentic―mythical.
この宗教は根拠が無い
The faith is without foundation.
君はなにか根拠があってそう言うのか
Have you any authority for your statement?
君はどういう根拠があってそう言うのか
On what authority do you say so?―What is the authority for your statement?
充分根拠があってそう思うのだ
There are ample grounds for thinking so.
実利を根拠とする道徳
morality on the basis of utility―morality based on utility

content:
こんぎょう〔今暁〕
〈副〉Early this moring

content.content: 今暁五時微震ありたり
A slight shock was felt at five this morning.

ごんぎょう〔勤行〕
〈名〉Religious service

content:
こんきょち〔根拠地〕
〈名〉A base of operations; a point d'appui

content.content: 澎湖島を海軍根拠地とする
to make the Pescadores the naval base
根拠地を設ける
to establish a base
彼は仙台を根拠地として候補者に立った
He stood for Sendai.

content:
こんく〔困苦〕
〈名〉Hardships; privations; adversity

content.content: 困苦を嘗める
to go through hardships―undergo hardships―see hardships―suffer privations―struggle with adversity―taste the bitters of life
彼はずいぶん困苦を嘗めている
He has gone through much.
困苦に堪える
to endure hardships and privations―bear one's cross

content:
こんくらべ〔根比べ〕
〈名〉A trial of perseverance; a waiting game:(=する) to play the waiting game; to see which can hold out longer

content.content: 今の戦争は根比べだ
Modern warfare is a waiting game.

content:
こんくりーと〔混凝土<コンクリート>〕
〈名〉Concrete

content.content: 土台をコンクリートで固める
to concrete the foundation
鉄骨コンクリート
reinforced concrete
鉄筋コンクリート
ferro-concrete
鉄筋コンクリートの建物
a ferro-concrete structure

content:
こんくりーと〔混凝土<コンクリート>〕
〈名〉Concrete

content.content: 土台をコンクリートで固める
to concrete the foundation
鉄骨コンクリート
reinforced concrete
鉄筋コンクリート
ferro-concrete
鉄筋コンクリートの建物
a ferro-concrete structure

content:
ごんげ〔権化〕
〈名〉The incarnation, the avatar (of some spirit); the personification, the impersonation (of some quality)

content.content: 日本人は礼儀の権化だ
The Japanese is the impersonation of politeness―the personification of politeness―politeness itself.
彼は悪魔の権化ともいうべき男だ
He is a devil incarnate―an incarnate fiend.
彼は勢力の権化だ
He is the avatar of energy.

content:
こんげつ〔今月〕
〈名、副〉This month; the current month:(日に伴えば) instant (inst.―と略す)

content.content: 今月始めに入学した
I entered at the beginning of the month.
今月末に払う
I will pay you at the end of the month.
今月十日に会を開く
The meeting will be held on the 10th inst.
今月中にできます
It will be ready in the course of the month―before the month is out.

content:
こんけつじ〔混血児〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: あいのこ〔間の子〕

content:
こんげん〔根元〕
〈名〉The origin, the source, the cause, the root (of anything)

content.content: 物の根元を探す
to trace anything to its source―to its origin
事の根元を究める
to go to the root of the matter
欲は万禍の根元
Love of money is the root of all evil.
あの人の病気の根元は酒だ
Wine is at the root of his illness―at the bottom of his illness.

content:
ごんげん〔権現〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ごんげ〔権化〕

content:
こんご〔今後〕
〈副〉Hereafter; henceforth; in future

content.content: 今後は気をつけろ
You must be more careful hereafter―after this.
今後は慎みます
I shall be more careful in future―for the future.
今後は酒を絶ちます
I shall abstain from wine henceforth―from this time forth―from this day forward―from this day onward―from now on.

content:
こんこう〔混淆〕
〈名〉A confused mixture; a medley; a miscellany; a hotch-potch; a jumble; a huddle:(=する) to mix up; to jumble together; to huddle together

content.content: 玉石混淆
an indiscriminate mixture―thread and thrum
雅俗混淆
a medley of classical and vulgar styles

こんごう〔根号〕
〈名〉A radical sign

content:
こんごう〔混合〕
〈名〉(事)mixture; admixture; commixture; intermixture:(物) a mixture; a medley; a miscellany; a hotch-potch:(=する) to mix, commix, intermix, mingle, commingle, intermingle (with something―something with something else)

content.content: 水と油は混合せぬ
Oil does not mix with water.
混合物
a mixture―a medley―a hotch-potch
混合物と化合物とは混同してはならぬ
You must not confound a mixture with a compound.
機械的混合物

(男女)混合浴
promiscuous bathing
(男女)混合教育
co-education
(算術の)混合比例
a mixed proportion
(数学の)混合法
alligation

content:
こんごうしゃ〔金剛砂〕
〈名〉Emery

content.content: 金剛砂紙
emery paper
金剛砂で磨く
to rub anything with emery-paper

content:
こんごうせき〔金剛石〕
〈名〉Diamond

content.content: 金剛石ほど堅い物は無い
Nothing is harder than diamonds.
金剛石を磨く
to cut a diamond
磨いた金剛石
a cut diamond
磨かぬ金剛石
a rough diamond―a diamond in the rough
二十四面形金剛石
a rose diamond―a rose-cut diamond―a rosette
表裏共刻んだ金剛石
a brilliant
一百カラット以上の完全な金剛石
a paragon

こんごうづえ〔金剛杖〕
〈名〉An alpenstock

content:
こんごうりき〔金剛力〕
〈名〉Herculean strength

content.content: 金剛力を出す
to put forth Herculean strength

content:
ごんごどうだん〔言語道断〕
〈形〉Unspeakable (conduct); unutterable (behaviour); abominable (custom); execrable (roads); atrocious (treatment); outrageous (pronunciation); crass (ignorance); monstrous (cruelty); absurd (proposal); preposterous (demands); exorbitant (price); egregious (blunder); flagitious (crime); vile (taste or smell); impossible (costume, etc.)

content.content: あんな者を校長にするとは言語道断だ
It is absurd―preposterous―monstrous―outrageous―atrocious―that such a man should be made principal.
今日中に立退けとは言語道断の要求だ
That we should quit in the course of the day, is a preposterous demand.
言語道断の仕打ちだ
His conduct towards me is outrageous.
言語道断の処置だ
It is an atrocious measure.
彼の発言は言語道断だ
His pronunciation is atrocious―outrageous.

content:
ごんごにぜっす〔言語に絶す〕
〈熟語〉To be unspeakable; to be unutterable; to be indescribable; beyond description

content.content: その美言語に絶す
It is beautiful beyond description―Its beauty baffles description―defies description―beggars description.

content:
こんこん〔懇々〕
〈副〉Earnestly; seriously

content.content: 懇々説論した
I talked seriously to him.
彼の不心得を懇々説論してやった
I earnestly reasoned with him on his mistake.

content:
こんこん〔渾々〕
〈副〉Freely

content.content: こんこんと流れる
to flow freely
こんこんたる流れ
a free flow of water
こんこんと湧き出る
to gush free

ごんさい〔権妻〕
〈名〉(A former name for) a concubine, a subordinate wife

content:
こんざつ〔混雑〕
〈名〉
1. (=混乱)confusion; disorder:(=する) to be confused; to be disordered; to be in confusion; to be at sixes and sevens

content.content: 書類がだいぶ混雑している
The papers are in great confusion―at sixes and sevens.
到るところ混雑を極む
All is confusion.
近火のために家の中が混雑している
The house is in confusion owing to a fire in the neighbourhood―A fire in the neighbourhood has thrown the house into confusion.
家の中は上を下への大混雑
The house is topsyturvy.
彼は混雑に紛れて逃げた
He profited by the confusion to effect his escape.
混雑の際、御尊命伺い洩れも可有之乍略儀紙上以て御礼申上候
Lest some names should have been out in the confusion, I take the liberty of thanking you through the press.
大混雑
There is confusion worse confounded.
彼の話は混雑している
His ideas are confused.
表は押すな押すなの混雑だ
There is a jostling crowd in front.

content: 2. (=複雑)complication; intricacy; complexity:(=する) complicated; intricate; complex; mixed up

content.content: 混雑した事件だ
It is a complicated affair.
混雑した問題だ
It is an intricate problem.
混雑した仕掛けだ
It is a complex mechanism.
混雑した文章だ
It is an involved style.
彼の説明は混雑している
His explanations are mixed up.

こんし〔恨死〕
〈名〉Death from despite:(=する) to die of mere despite

content:
こんじ〔恨事〕
〈名〉A matter for regret; a regrettable matter; a deplorable matter; a rueful matter

content.content: これ小生終生の恨事に御座候
It will be a matter for my lasting regret―It will be a lifelong regret with me―I shall ever rue the hour.

content:
こんじ〔根治〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: こんち〔根治〕

content:
こんじ〔紺地〕
〈名〉Blue cloth; blue ground

content.content: 紺地に金の模様
gold design on blue ground
紺地に金は引立つ
Gold shows well on blue.

content:
こんじき〔金色〕
〈名〉Golden colour:(=の) golden

content.content: 金色堂
a golden hall
金色夜叉
a usurer

content:
こんじゃく〔今昔〕
〈名〉The contrast between the present and past; the change of times

content.content: 今昔の感に堪えず
I can not help feeling how the times have changed―I can not but moralize on the change of times.

content:
こんしゅう〔今週〕
〈名、副〉This week

content.content: 今週帰る
I go home this week.
今週はこれでおしまい
I have finished work for the week.
仕事は今週中にやってしまう
I will get my work finished in the course of the week―before the week is out.

content:
こんじょう〔今生〕
〈名〉This life; this world

content.content: あれが今生の別れであった
That was our last meeting in this world―I then saw him for the last time―That was the last I saw of him.
これ今生のいとまごい
This is our last meeting in this world―I now see you for the last time―This will be the last I shall see of you.

こんじょう〔懇情〕
〈名〉A kindly feeling; kindness

content:
こんじょう〔根性〕
〈名〉Nature; spirit

content.content: 根性の悪い人だ
He is an ill-natured man.
根性が曲っている
He is perverse―crabbed―cross-grained―wrong-headed.
根性が汚い
He is mean―base.
根性が腐っている
He has a corrupt heart.
あれが畜生根性というものだ
That is the nature of the beast.
商人根性
a sordid spirit
奉公人根性
a mercenary spirit
泥棒根性
a sneaking spirit
島国根性
an insular spirit
乞食根性
a mendicant spirit
人は貧乏すると乞食根性が出る
When a man is reduced to poverty, the beggar comes out.
助平根性を出す
to act from selfish motives

こんじょう〔紺青〕
〈名〉Prussian blue; ultramarine

ごんじょうする〔言上する〕
〈他動〉To say, state, relate (to a superior)

こんじょうまがり〔根性曲り〕
〈名〉A perverse man; a crabbed man; a cross-grained man; a wrong-headed man

content:
こんじる〔混じる〕
〈自他動〉→『

content.content: こんずる〔混ずる〕

content:
こんしん〔懇親〕
〈名〉Sociability; conviviality; good fellowship; friendship:(=の) sociable; convivial; friendly

content.content: 懇親を回る
to promote sociability―further good fellowship
懇親を結ぶ
to contract a friendship with one
懇親会
a social gathering―convivial meeting―a friendly reunion―(米国にては)―a sociable

content:
こんしん〔渾身〕
〈名〉One's whole body:(より)one's whole being:(=の) whole; all

content.content: 渾身の勇気をふるう
to muster up all one's courage
渾身の力をふるって働いた
I worked with all my might.
君には渾身の愛を捧げている
I love you with all my heart and soul.

content:
こんしんかい〔懇親会〕
〈名〉A social gathering; a convivial meeting; a friendly reunion:(米国にては)a sociable

content.content: 懇親会を開く
to hold a social gathering
今日は懇親会へ行かにゃなれぬ
I must attend social gathering today.
昨夜の懇親会は盛会であった
Last night's meeting was a big success.

content:
こんすい〔昏睡〕
〈名〉Coma; lethargy

content.content: 昏睡に陥る
to fall into coma―fall into lethargy

こんすう〔根数〕
〈名〉A root; a radical

こんずる〔混ずる〕
〈自他動〉
1. (=混和する)to mix, mingle, blend (with something―something with something else)
2. (=混同する)to confound, confuse, mix up (one thing with another)

content:
こんせい〔懇請〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: こんがん〔懇願〕

content:
こんせい〔混成〕
〈形〉Mixed; composite:(=する) to mix

content.content: 混成旅団
a mixed brigade―a composite brigade
混成酒
a mixed wine
混成語
a hybrid word
混成物
a mixture―a medley―a miscellany

content:
こんせき〔痕跡〕
〈名〉Marks; traces; vestiges; evidences; indications; signs ［注意］打消のほかは皆複数。

content.content: 開封した痕跡がある
There are signs of the seal having been tampered with.
人の入った痕跡がある
There are traces of man―vestiges of man―evidences of man―indications of man.
人の入った痕跡が無い
There is no trace of man―no vestige of man―no evidence of man―no indication of man.
その島には人の住んだ痕跡が見える、痕跡が見えぬ
The island shows traces of human habitation―shows no trace of human habitation.
彼の手には労働をした痕跡がある、痕跡が無い
His hands bear marks of toil―bear no mark of toil.
他殺の痕跡あり
There are signs of violent hands having been laid on him.
死体には他殺の痕跡が見える、痕跡が見えぬ
The body bears marks of violence―bears no mark of violence.
毒害の痕跡あり
There are evidences of poisoning.
絞め殺された痕跡がある
There are marks of his having been strangled.
烈しき奮闘の痕跡地面に歴然たり
The ground shows unmistakable marks of a fierce struggle.
泥棒が天窓から入った痕跡がある
There are evidences of the burglar having entered by the skylight.
この文は筆を入れた痕跡が見える
The composition shows evidences of correction.
アイヌ人は本州に痕跡を残している
The Ainos have left their traces behind them in the main island.
本州にアイヌ人の痕跡が残っている
Traces of the Ainos remain in the main island―The main island shows races of the Ainos.
全く痕跡を留めぬ都会がある
Some cities have left no trace behind them―No trace remains of some cities―Some cities have been wiped off the face of the earth.
古代文明の痕跡
vestiges of ancient civilization

content:
こんせつ〔懇切〕
〈形〉Kind; complaisant; obliging; accommodating

content.content: ご懇切なるご教授を感謝致します
I must thank you for your kind instruction.
説明最も懇切
The explanations are to the point.
註解極めて懇切
There are copious notes.

content:
こんぜつ〔根絶〕
〈名〉Eradication; extirpation; extermination:(=する) to eradicate; to extirpate; to exterminate; to root out

content.content: 悪弊を根絶する
to eradicate an evil―root out an abuse

content:
こんせん〔混戦〕
〈名〉A mixed fight; a m?l?e

content.content: それから混戦になった
Then there was a m?l?e.
同市には三派の混戦が始まっている
A mixed fight is going on among three parties in the city.

content:
こんせん〔混線〕
〈名〉Entanglement of wires:(=する) to get entangled; to get crossed

content.content: 混線して電話が通じない
The wires have got crossed, and the telephone will not work.

content:
こんぜん〔渾然〕
〈副〉(Existing) in a state of all-round completeness, without excess or deficiency

content.content: 宇宙は渾然として玉の如し
The universe is a complete whole.

こんだく〔混濁〕
〈名〉Turbidity:(=する) to be turbid:(=せる) turbid

content:
こんだて〔献立〕
〈名〉A bill of fare; a menu

content.content: 献立て書き
a menu card―a bill of fare
献立通りの食事をする
to dine ? la carte

content:
こんたん〔魂胆〕
〈名〉A secret design; a secret scheme; a plot; a game

content.content: 陰に何か魂胆がありそうだ
There must be some secret design behind.
これは深い魂胆のある事件だ
This is a deep-laid plot.
あの男は深い魂胆がある
He is playing a deep game.
あの男深い魂胆のありそうな男だ
He is a deep fellow―a deep one.

こんだん〔懇談〕
〈名〉A familiar talk; a chat; a confabulation; a confab:(=する) to have a familiar talk (with one); to chat (with one)

content:
こんち〔根治〕
〈名〉Radical cure:(=する) to cure radically; to effect a radical cure; to strike at the root of (the evil); to lay the axe to the root of (the evil)

content.content: 肺病は根治し難い
It is difficult to effect a radical cure of consumption.
この病は根治しないと再発する
The disease must be cured radically, or there will be a relapse.
根治法、根治薬
an eradicative

content:
こんちゅう〔昆虫〕
〈名〉An insect

content.content: 昆虫を採集する
to collect insects―entomologize
昆虫学
insectology―entomology
昆虫学者
an insectologist―an entomologist

content:
こんちょう〔今朝〕
〈名、副〉This morning

content.content: 今朝出発致します
I leave this morning.

content:
こんてい〔根底〕
〈名〉The root; the bottom; the foundation:(=の) radical; fundamental

content.content: 君の説は根底から間違っている
Your views are fundamentally wrong.
この事は根底から調査せねばならぬ
We must probe the matter to the bottom.
根底から改革する
to effect a radical reform―revolutionize
この習慣は社会の根底が深い
The custom is deeply rooted in society.
あの地方の仏教は根底が堅い
Buddhism is firmly rooted in that country.
その説が証明されたならばキリスト教の根底がぐらつく
If that theory were proved, it would shake the foundation of Christianity―shake the Christian faith to its foundations.

こんてんぎ〔渾天儀〕
〈名〉A celestial globe

ごんてんじ〔権典侍〕
〈名〉A court lady of the second rank

content:
こんど〔今度〕
〈副〉
1. (=このたび)this time; now:(=の) the present; the new

content.content: 今度は成功するつもりだ
I expect to succeed this time.
今度こそ逃がさないぞ
He shall not escape me this time.
今度は僕の番だ
It is my turn now.
彼が失敗したのは今度が初めてではない
This is not the first time he has failed.
今度だけ僕の言うことを聴いてくれ給え
Listen to me for this time!―for this once!
将来慎むなら今度だけは勘弁してやる
If you will be more careful in future, I will pardon you for this time.
今度きり説明する
I will explain it once for all.
今度の先生は前の先生よりも学問ができる
The present teacher is a better scholar than the former one.
今度の先生は生徒の受けはどうか
How does the new teacher get on with the students?

content: 2. (=この次)next time:(=の) the next; the coming

content.content: 今度のことにしよう
I will do it next time.
今度は君の番だ
It is your turn next.
今度行く時連れて行こう
I will take you there the next time I go.
今度来る時連れて来よう
I will bring him with me the next time I come.
今度会ったら言っておこう
I will say so the next time I see him.
今度の試験には及第するつもりだ
I expect to pass the next examination.
今度の議題は何ですか
What is the next subject for discussion?
今度の演説は誰の番ですか
Who is the next speaker on the cards?
今度の日曜に行く
I am going next Sunday.
今度の休暇はどこへ行くか
Where are you going during the (coming) holidays?

content: 3. (=近頃)lately:(=の) late

content.content: 彼は今度米国へ行った
He has lately gone to America.
彼は今度の試験に及第した
He has passed the late examination.
彼は今度の事件に関係がある
He is implicated in the late affair.

content: 4. (=近々)shortly

content.content: 彼は今度洋行することになりました
He is shortly to go abroad.
彼の弟は今度外国から帰る
His brother shortly returns from abroad.

content:
5. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 今度はこちらから教えてやった
I taught him in my turn―It was my turn to teach him.
今度からこんなことをしてはいけない
You must not do so again.
今度から気をつけます
I will be more careful after this―in future―for the future.

こんとう〔昏倒〕
〈名〉Falling from vertigo:(=する) to fall from dizziness

content:
こんどう〔混同〕
〈名〉Confusion:(=する) to confuse, confound, mix up (one thing with another)

content.content: 公私を混同する
to mix up public and private matters
金そのものを愛するのは手段と目的を混同するのである
To love money for itself is to confound the means with the end.
自由と放縦とを混同する人が往々ある
People often confuse liberty with licence.
名詞と動詞を混同するな
Do not mix up nouns with verbs.

こんとく〔坤徳〕
〈名〉The virtues of an Empress

content:
こんとく〔懇篤〕
〈形〉Kind; warm; hearty; cordial

content.content: 最も懇篤な待遇を受けた
I received a most cordial reception.
彼に懇篤な送別をしてやれ
You must give him a hearty send-off.
懇篤なるご挨拶痛み入る
I must thank you for your cordial greeting.
懇篤なるお手紙正に落手
Your kind letter is duly to hand.

content:
こんとん〔渾沌〕
〈名〉Chaos:(=たる) chaotic

content.content: 渾沌を治めて秩序を立てる
to reduce chaos to order―bring order out of chaos
ロシアの内情は渾沌たるものだ
The internal affairs of Russia are in a chaotic state.

content:
こんな〔斯んな〕
〈形〉Such; like this; of the kind; this kind of; this sort; this sort of:(=に) so; so much

content.content: 僕はこんな本は読まない
I do not read such books.
誰がこんな本を読むものか
Who will read such a book?
こんな物は要らん
I don't want such trash.
こんな物じゃない
It is nothing of the kind.
本当の戦いはこんなものではない
A true battle is nothing like this.
こんなにたくさんある
Here is such a lot!
こんなにうまく行こうとは思わなかった
I did not expect to succeed so well.
金をこんなにたくさんどうする
What are you going to so with so much money?―all this money?
こんなにたくさんの本が読めるか
Can you read do many books?―all these books?
こんな目に逢うのはへその緒切って初めてだ
I never had such an experience in all my born days.［注意］打消に伴えば “so”は“more”となる。
こんな面白い本を読んだことは無い
I never read a more interesting book.
こんな面白い芝居を見たことが無い
I never saw a more amusing play.
こんなうまい物を食ったことが無い
I never tasted anything better.
こんなわけの無いこと無い
Nothing is easier―Nothing can be simpler―(than this)

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 僕は病気でこんなになってしまった
I am reduced to this condition by illness―(他動詞構 文にすれば)―Illness has reduced me to this condition.
地震で家がこんなになった
The earthquake has reduced the house to this condition.
こんな身体に誰がした
You have made me what I am.
おおかたこんなことだろうと思った
I knew how it would be―I was prepared for this.
こんなことになろうとは思わなっかた
I was not prepared for this―That things should have come to this!
こんなふうに、こんな工合にやるのだ
You must do it in this way―in this manner.

content:
こんなん〔困難〕
〈名〉
1. (=むずかしいこと)difficulty:(=な) difficult (problem); hard (task); tough (job); troublesome (to learn):(=する) to find difficulty (in doing something); to find it difficult (to do something)

content.content: 困難に打勝つ
to overcome a difficulty―surmount an obstacle
この困難には打勝てぬ
The difficulty is not to be overcome―The difficulty is insurmountable.
この事業は困難が多い
The undertaking is best with difficulties.
支那内地は旅行が困難だ
Travelling is difficult―The traveler is beset with difficulties―in the interior of China.
これは困難な事業だ
This is a difficult undertaking.
事業の困難なことは承知している
I know that the work is difficult―I am aware of the difficulty of the work.
どんな困難があっても目的を遂行する
I will accomplish my purpose in spite of any difficulty―Nothing shall hinder me from accomplishing my purpose.
あらゆる困難を排して目的を遂げる決心だ
I am determined to accomplish my purpose in spite of all difficulties―at any cost―at all costs―Nothing shall hinder me from accomplishing my purpose.
成功するには種々の困難がある
There are many difficulties in the way of success.
困難は人選に在り
The difficulty lies in the choice of men.
困難に遭遇する
to meet with a difficulty―encounter a difficulty
困難を見て二の足を踏むな
Don't boggle at a difficulty!
困難を感ずる
to feel some difficulty―find some difficulty-experience some difficulty
別に困難を感ぜぬ
I feel no particular difficulty―I find no great difficulty―(in doing it).
漢字は学ぶに困難だ
Chinese characters are troublesome to learn.
困難を解決する
to solve a difficulty
困難の解決
a solution of the difficulty―a way out (of the difficulty)
困難な仕事だ
It is a hard task―a tough job.
困難な問題だ
It is a hard question―a difficult problem―a perplexing problem―a puzzling question.
この問題を解決するに大いに困難した
I found great difficulty in solving this problem―I found it very difficult to solve this problem.
日本軍は旅順攻撃には大いに困難した
The Japanese had to overcome great difficulties in besieging Port Arthur.

content: 2. (=困ること)difficulty; trouble; embarrassment; perplexity; straits:(=な) embarrassing; perplexing; awkward:(=する) to be in difficulty; to be in trouble; to be embarrassed; to be perplexed; to be in straits; to be hard put to it

content.content: 困難に陥る
to get into trouble―get into difficulties
彼は困難に陥っている
He is in trouble―in hot water-in deep waters―(財政困難なら)―in difficulties.
財政困難
pecuniary difficulties―financial embarrassment
困難をしのぐ
to tide over a difficulty
彼は生計が困難だ
He is in straitened circumstances―in distressed circumstances.
困難なことが起こった
Here is an embarrassing turn of affairs―a perplexing state of affairs―an awkward state of things―a pretty kettle of fish―a rum go―Here's a go―What a go!
そこが困難なところだ
There lies the trouble.
彼は金が無くて困難している
He is embarrassed for funds―pressed for money―hard up (for money).
家族を養うに困難している
He is hard put to it to support his family.
困難な立場
an awkward situation―a delicate position
君にそうされると僕の立場が困難になる
You place me in a delicate position.

content: 3. (=難儀)suffering; distress; hardship:(=な) suffering; distressed:(=する) to suffer; to be in distress; to see hardships

content.content: 遺族は困難している
The bereaved family is in distress.
物入つづきで大いに困難している
A constant drain on my purse has left me in great distress.
彼は貧乏で困難している
He is suffering from poverty―pressed by poverty.
台湾へ行くものは暑さで困難する
People suffer from the heat in Formosa.
困難を経る
to undergo hardships―go through hardships

content:
こんにち〔今日〕
〈名、副〉
1. (=本日)today; this day

content.content: 今日ご出発ですか
Are you leaving today?
その記事は今日の新聞にでています
The account appeared in today's paper.
今日より禁酒
I give up drinking from this day onward―from this day forward―from this day forth―from now on.
今日に至るまで実費はわからずにいる
The facts remain unknown to this day.
先月の今日、来月の今日
this day month
先週の今日、来週の今日
this day week

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この仕事は今日中に仕上げなければならぬ
I must get the work finished in the course of the day―before the day is out.
彼は今日午後三時に到着致します
He arrives this afternoon at three―He arriver at three in the afternoon.
これが今日までに知れた事実です
These are the facts that have been found out up to date―down to date.
今日はおめでとう
I wish you joy of the occasion―I congratulate you on the occasion.
今日は
Good day!―(朝なら)―Good morning!―(午後なら)―Good afternoon!

content: 2. (=当今)today; nowadays; these days; these times

content.content: 今日の日本は十年前の日本ではない
The Japan of today is not what she was ten years ago.
今日では戦闘鑑が日本でできるようになった
Battleships are built in Japan nowadays.
物価騰貴の今日ではこの家賃は全く安いものだ
The rent is quite cheap in these days of high prices.
開明の今日そんなことがあってたまるものか
How can such a thing be possible in these times of enlightenment?

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 英国の今日あるのは鉄と石炭の賜物である
Iron and coal have made England what she is.
私の今日あるは皆あなたのお陰です
You have made me what I am―I owe you everything in life.

こんにちぐらし〔今日暮し〕
〈名〉A hand-to-mouth existence:(=する) to live from hand to mouth

content:

content: 2. ［注意］「最後に」を形容詞に訳す。例えば

content.content: 最後に来た人
(the man who came last―と言わずして) the last man who came.
彼は最後に来た
(He came last―と言わずして) He was the last man who came―the last to come―the last to come.
最後に受けた傷が致命傷となった
The last wound he received proved mortal.
彼は最後に去った
He left last of all―(とも言うが、通例は)―He was the last to leave.
船が沈没する時は船長が最後に船を去る
The captain is the last man to leave a sinking ship.

Once he says he will do anything, he never swerves from his resolution.
いやだなどとぬかしたら最後、命は無いぞ
If you refuse, you are a dead man.

content:
ざいさん〔財産〕
〈名〉
1. A fortune; an estate; property; wealth (one's worldly wealth); substance; goods; possessions; belongings; means:(負債に対しては)assets (and liabilities)

content.content: 彼は財産が有るか
Has he any property?―Has he a fortune?
財産というほどのものは無い
He has no property worth mentioning―no property to speak of.
相応な財産が有る
He has a competent fortune―a competence―a sufficiency.
(働かないでも食えるだけのいわゆる)独立財産がある
He has independent property―an independence.
いくら財産が有るか
What is he worth?
百万の財産が有る
He is worth a million.
百万の財産を残して死んだ
He died worth a million.
財産をこしらえる
to make a fortune―make a pile
彼はどうして財産をこしらえたか
How did he make his fortune?―make his pile?
あやしい儲けでこしらえた財産だ
He has built up his fortune by questionable gains.
彼は相応な財産をこしらえた
He has acquired a competence―acquired a sufficiency.
彼は相場に手を出して財産を無くした
He has lost his fortune by dabbling in speculation.
財産を蕩尽する
to squander one's fortune―go through one's fortune
彼の父は財産を残して死んだ
His father left him a fortune.
息子に財産を譲る
to make over one's property to one's son
彼は子どもらに財産を譲って隠退した
He has transferred his property to his children, and retired from active life.
親譲りの財産
an inheritance―a heritage―a patrimony
子どもらに財産を分ける
to divide one's property among one's children
子どもに財産を付ける
to settle a fortune on a child
財産分与
division of property among one's children―settlement of property among one's children
財産を譲り受ける
(親からなら)to inherit one's father's property―(小父などからなら)―come into a fortune―step into a fortune
財産を相続する
to inherit a fortune―accede to one's property―come to one's property―(相続が問題になれば)―succeed to one's property―(小父などの財産なら)―come into a fortune―step into a fortune
財産相続
accession to one's property―succession to one's property
相続財産
an inheritance―a heritage
財産を保管する
to hold property in trust
財産を差し押さえる
to attach one's property
財産差し押さえ
attachment of property
財産と負債
assets and liabilities
彼は負債に対する財産が無い
He has no assets to set against his liabilities.
負債以上の財産が有る
He has assets in excess of his liabilities.
(簿記の)財産勘定
assets and liabilities accounts
僕は健康だけの財産だ
Health is the only assets at my disposal.

Law protects life and property.

He has expectations―He is a man of expectations.

人の真価は財産にあらずして人物に在り
A man's true worth lies, not in what he has, but in what he is.

He is proud of his wealth―He stands on his riches―He is purse-proud.

You should not invest your all in a single enterprise―risk your all on a single venture―put all your eggs in a single basket.

(the man who came first―と言わずして) the first man who came.

僕が最初米国へ行って、次に弟が行った(人に打つ番号)

僕は最初米国へ行ってそれから英国へ行った(働きに打つ番号)

僕が最初英語を習って次に弟が習った

〈名〉Finances; financial affairs; coffers:(個人なら)one's affairs:(=の) financial; fiscal; pecuniary

content.content: 財政状態
financial condition―the state of one's affairs―the state of one's coffers
君は財政状態はどうか
What is the state of your coffers?
財政状態は堅実だ
My financial condition is sound.
彼は財政が豊かだ
He is financially well off.
財政を処理する
to manage one's affairs
彼は自分の財政を管理することができない
He can not manage his own affairs―control his own affairs.
財政紊乱{びんらん}
His affairs are in confusion―His affairs are at sixes and sevens.
財政を整理する
to order one's affairs―arrange one's affairs―adjust disordered finances―regulate disordered finances
財産整理
financial regulation―financial adjustment
財政を監督する
to control the finance
議会の主要なる権能は財政の監督と法案の審議とにあり
The chief functions of the Diet are to control the finances and to deliberate on legislative measures.
財政困難
financial embarrassment―(個人なら)―pecuniary difficulties
財政困難に陥っている
(中国政府なら)The Chinese government is in financial embarrassment―(個人なら)―He is in difficulties―in pecuniary difficulties.
彼は財政が困難だ
His affairs are involved.
彼は僕の財政困難を助けてくれた
He has helped me out of my difficulties.
そんなぜいたくは財政が許さぬ
I can not afford such extravagance.
財政逼迫
strained finances―financial pressure
財政政策
a financial policy―a fiscal policy
財政計画
a financial programme
彼は財政権を握っている
He has the control of expenditure―He holds the purse-strings.
財政学
(the science of) finance
財政家
a financier

content:

content.content: せきさい〔積載〕

content:
ざいせき〔罪跡〕
〈名〉Proof of guilt; evidence of crime

content.content: 罪跡を煙滅する
to destroy the proofs of guilt―make away with the evidence of crime
罪跡をくらます、罪跡を隠蔽する
to cover the traces of guilt
罪跡を探り出す
to trace out a crime
予審で罪跡が現れた
The proof of gilt came to light at the preliminary examination―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The preliminary examination brought the proof of guilt to light.

There is no need of going into details here.

I have been listening behind the door for some while.

〈名〉Scrubbing up; house-work:(=する) to scrub up; to do house-work

content:
さいそく〔催促〕
〈名〉Pressing; demand; importunity:(=する) to press (for payment―one for payment); to push (one for payment); to demand (payment); to urge (one to pay); to call upon (one to pay); to dun (one for a debt); to importune (one for anything); to hasten, hurry (a person or thing)

content.content: 貸金の催促をする
to press one for payment―push one for payment―demand payment of a debt―urge one to pay a debt―call upon one to pay a debt―dun one for a debt
(金を貸すのもよいが)催促するのがいやだ
I do not like to press for payment.
あの人は催促しないと金を返さない
He won't pay if you do not press him.
いくら催促されても無い物は返せない
You may press me as much as you like, but you can't wring water from flint.
そううるさく催促するなよ
Don't importune me so!
そう言うと催促に当たるようだが
If I say so, I may seem to remind you of your debt.
先方では返事の催促をしている
The other party presses for an answer.
矢の催促だ
I am hourly pressed for an answer.
矢の催促をする
to make an urgent demand
子どもが乳を催促しているじゃないか
Don't you hear the baby crying for a suck?
遅いから催促して来よう
They are late―I'll hurry them up.
帰る帰ると言うのは何かの催促だろう
He talks of going to hasten something.

content:

〈名〉(The holy estate of) matrimony; wedded bliss:(=する) to marry

He is married.
妻帯生活
married life―wedded life―matrimony
妻帯の身になる
to get married―change one's condition

The priests were absolved from the vows of celibacy and abstinence from animal food.

the greatest happiness of the greatest number

content.content: 細大漏らさず述べた
I stated everything to the minutes detail.
細大漏らさず報告した
I explained everything in detail.
細大漏らさず物語った
I gave a detailed account of the affair―gave a minute account of the affair―gave a full account of the affair.
細大ともに観察する
to observe both the general effect and the minute details

〈名〉Selection; adoption:(=する) to select; to adopt

午後はいつも在宅です
I am always at home in the afternoon.

I protest against the ruling of the president.
裁断流るるが如し
He is prompt in decision.

〈前置詞相当〉Amidst; in the midst of; in the height of; in course of; under

content.content: 暴風雨の最中に船を出した
We put to sea amidst the storm.
戦争の最中にできた船だ
The ship was built in the midst of the war.
今が暑い最中だ
We are in the height of the hot season.
家は建築の最中だ
The house is in course of construction―under construction.
計画はいま詮議の最中だ
The project is under discussion.
行ってみると家族は朝飯の最中だった
I found the family at breakfast.

content: 〈副〉At its height; in full swing

content.content: 宴会はいま最中だ
The banquet is at its height.
暴風雨の最中だ
The storm is at its height―A storm is raging.
火事の最中だ
A fire is raging.
戦いの最中だ
A battle is raging.
仕事の最中だ
The work is in full swing.

最低価格

〈名〉A calamity; a disaster; a misfortune; a fatality; a catastrophe; an accident; a mishap; a misadventure

content.content: 彼が死んだのは国家の災難だ
His death is a calamity to the nation.
こんな船を失ったら海軍の災難だ
The loss of such a ship would be a disaster to the navy.
あの女を知ったのが僕の災難さ
It was my misfortune to know her―I met her in an evil hour.
彼は悪い細君を持って災難だ
He is unfortunate in his wife―unfortunate in his marriage.
そんな女を貰った人こそ災難だ
Woe to the man who marries such a wife!
災難に逢う
to meet with a calamity
不時の災難に逢う
to have a mishap―have a misadventure
彼は災難続きだ
He has met with a chapter of accidents.
災難にかかる
to suffer from a disaster
とんだ災難でしたね
What a calamity!―What a mishap!
災難と諦めるよりほかは無い
There is nothing for it but to resign yourself to your lot.
災難を除ける、悪事災難を除ける
to avert a calamity―keep off evil
災難除け
a charm against accidents

content.content: 歳入歳出
revenue and expenditure

The State revenue and expenditure swell year after year.

the Budget

content.content: 在任十年

〈名〉
1. (=法律上の罪人)a criminal; an offender; a culprit; a malefactor

content.content: 彼は正に刑法上の罪人だ
He is a positive criminal under the penal laws.
暴利商は世の罪人だ
A profiteer is a malefactor to the world.
昔は罪人を拷問に掛けたり引きまわしたりしたものだ
In former times, criminals were put to torture and led through the streets.

content: 2. (=宗教道徳上の罪人)a sinner; a transgressor; a delinquent

content.content: この哀れなる罪人を憐れみ給え
Have mercy on me, a miserable sinner!

content.content: あの男は罪人相が有る

content.content: 才能の有る人はなにをしても傑出する
An able man―A talented man―A man of talent―will attain eminence in any profession.
君のように才能の有る人にはわけのないことだろう
A man of your abilities must find it easy.
彼は才能は有るがまだ現れない
He has capabilities―He is a man of possibilities.
あの人は珍しい才能を備えている
He is gifted with rare mental powers.
才能を発揮する
to display one's abilities―exhibit one's powers―show one's talents

content.content: 野菜を賽の目に切る
to cut vegetables into small cubes

content.content: 頓首再拝
Very respectfully yours...

content:

〈名〉The baton of command; the truncheon of command

content.content: 采配を振る
to take the command―wield the sceptre―lay down the law―carry matters with a high hand
彼は学校で采配を振っている
He lays down the law at the school.
あの家では奥さんが万事采配を振っている
The mistress carries matters with a high hand in the family.
彼は顧問という名義で采配を振っている
He wields the sceptre under the name of adviser.

content:
さいばい〔栽培〕
〈名〉Cultivation; culture:(=する) to cultivate; to grow; to raise

content.content: あの地方では茶を栽培する
Tea is cultivated―Tea is grown―in that part of the country.
あの地方は茶の栽培に適している
The country is suited for tea culture.
菊の栽培法
the method of cultivating chrysanthemums―how to grow chrysanthemums

content:

content.content: この本は再版になった
The book has run into its second edition―reached a second edition.

content:
さいはん〔再犯〕
〈名〉The repetition of an offence; a second offence:(=する) to repeat the offence

content.content: 被告は再犯である
The prisoner has repeated the offence―He is a second offender.

content:
さいばん〔裁判〕
〈名〉Justice:(裁判中の裁判)trial; a hearing:(裁判の結果、判決)decision; judgment:(=する) to administer justice; to deal out justice and mercy:(人を裁判する)to judge (a person); to sit in judgment on (a man); to try (a prisoner); to give (one) a hearing:(事件を裁判する)to judge (a cause); to try (a case); to hear (a case):(裁判を申渡す)to pass judgment on (the prisoner); to decide on, give decision on (a case)

content.content: 判事が裁判する
A judge administers justice―deals out justice and mercy.
被告を裁判する
to judge the prisoner―try the prisoner―give the prisoner a hearing―pass judgment on the prisoner
事件を裁判する
to judge a cause―try a cause―hear a case―decide on a case―give decision on a case
公平に裁判する
to administer fair justice―bold the scales even
公平な裁判
fair justice―even-handed justice―impartial judgment
判事は公平な裁判をした
The judge passed an impartial judgment on the prisoner―gave an impartial decision on the case.
不公平な裁判、片手落の裁判だ
It is a one-sided decision―a partial judgment.
乱暴な裁判をする
to deal out justice in a rough way
真直に裁判する
to try a case on its merits―right one's wrongs
事件を裁判に付す
to put a case on trial―commit a case for trial
事件は裁判中
The case is under trial.
被告は裁判中
The prisoner is being tried―on trial.
裁判中は(裁判がきまるまでは)被告に面会を許さない
Pending the trial, the prisoner is not allowed to see visitors.
被告が裁判になる
A prisoner is tried.
事件が裁判になる
A case is put on trial―committed for trial.
裁判はいつ頃になるか
When is the trial coming on?
裁判は来月になるだろう
The trial will come on next month.
彼は重罪で裁判を受けた
He was tried for felony―He stood trial for felony.
輿論の裁判を受ける
to be tried at the bar of public opinion
裁判を仰ぐ
to lay a case before the court―submit a case to the court
正式の裁判を仰ぐ
to demand a regular trial―(英米にては)―put oneself on one's country
尋常に裁判をして下さい
Give me a fair hearing!
裁判をせずに罪に落とすのは酷だ
It is cruel to condemn without a hearing.
どちらが悪いかお父様に裁判して戴こう
Let our father judge between us!
裁判に勝つ
to win a suit―Decision is given in one's favour
裁判に負ける
to lose a suit―be cast in a suit―Decision is given against one
裁判は被告の勝訴となった
The case was decided in favour of the defendant―Decision was given in favour of the defendant―Judgment was given for the defendant.
裁判は原告の敗訴となった
The case was decided against the plaintiff―Decision was given against the plaintiff―Judgment was given against the plaintiff.
事件を裁判に持ち出す
to bring the matter before the court―bring an action against one―institute a suit against one―proceed against one―go to law―litigate
裁判事件
a case―a cause―a lawsuit
裁判沙汰
litigation
裁判沙汰にしたくない、裁判に持ち出したくない
I don't wish to go to law―I don't wish to bring the matter before the court.
裁判手続
legal procedure―judicial process
裁判権
jurisdiction
裁判医学
forensic medicine
裁判費用
(judicial) costs
予審裁判
preliminary examination
欠席裁判
judgment by default
即決裁判
summary justice―summary judgment―summary decision

裁判所書記

地方裁判所

区裁判所

content.content: 財布には金がいっぱい入っている
The purse is full of money―The purse is bursting with money.
財布が空だ
My purse is empty.
財布が空になる
I am running short of money―I am running out of money―Money is running short―Money is running out―Money is running low.

content.content: 僕でお役に立つなら幸いです
I shall be happy to be of service to you.

content: 2. (=幸運)good fortune; good luck:(=な) fortunate; lucky:(=にも) fortunately; by good fortune; luckily; by good luck; as good luck will have it; in a happy hour

content.content: 幸いにも成功した
By good luck I succeeded―I luckily succeeded―I was so lucky as to succeed―I had the good luck to succeed.
幸いにも良友を得た
By good fortune I won a friend―I fortunately won a friend―I was so fortunate as to win a friend―I had the good fortune to win a friend―I won a friend in a happy hour.
幸い彼は在宅でした
By good luck I found him at home―I luckily found him at home―I was so lucky as to find him at home―I had the good luck to find him at home.
彼は幸いな日月の下に生まれた人だ
He was born under a lucky star.
もっけの幸い
an unexpected piece of luck―a godsend―a windfall
しかしけがの無かったのが不幸中の幸いです
But you have got off without a scratch―that's one consolation.
不幸中にも幸いあり
“Every cloud has a silver lining.”

content: 〈副〉［注意］訳語一定せず。

content.content: 幸い彼が来たから付合って貰った
As he happened to come, I got him to bear me company.

As tomorrow happens to be a holiday, I should be happy to go with you.
幸い田中が居合わしたから通弁して貰った
As Tanaka happened to be by, I got him to interpret for me.
幸い御当地へ参りましたから出席することに致しましょう
Since I happen to be here, I shall have much pleasure in attending the meeting.
彼は僕が事情に暗いのを幸いに僕をだましおった
He took advantage of my ignorance to cheat me.
休みを幸いに旅行に出かけた
I took advantage of the holidays to go on a journey.
その男は主人の留守を幸いにたかりに来たのだ
He took advantage of the master's absence to obtain money under false pretences.
これを幸いに博物館を見て行こう
I will take this opportunity of visiting the Museum.
彼が来たのを幸いそのわけを聞いてみた
I took the occasion of his coming to ask him the reason.
親父が上京したのを幸いに金を絞ってやった
I took the occasion of my father's coming to town to squeeze some money from him.
彼に逢ったのを幸いに催促してやった
I took the occasion of my meeting him to press his for payment.
これ幸いと機会に乗じた

天気が悪かったからこれ幸いと言い訳した

〈副〉
1. (=さえも、すらも)even; the very; oneself; (not) so much as (do something)

content.content: 鬼神でさえ泣く
Even the gods cry―The very gods cry―The gods themselves cry―Even the very gods themselves cry.
召使いでさえ主人をばかにしている
His very servants despise him.
君が居さえすればよい
Your very presence will do.
帽子さえ取らない
They do not so much as take off their hats.

content: 2. (=さえすれば、さえあれば)(if) only; (if) but; so long as

content.content: 君は勉強さえすりゃ成功する
If you would only work hard, you would succeed.
勉強さえすりゃよい
You have only to work hard―All you have to do, is to work hard.
注意さえすりゃこんなことは無い
If you would but be careful, such things would not happen.
金さえ有ればできるのだが
If only I had money, I could do it.
金さえ有れば何でもできる
Money is everything.
君がうんと言いいさえすればよいのだ
If you will only say yes, that will do―You have only to say yes.
面白くさえあれば何でもよい
Anything will do, so long as it is interesting.
来さえすればいつでもよい
Any time will do, so long as you come.
金さえ有れば何も要らぬ
Money is the one thing needful―Money is everything.
僕の姿さえ見れば皆逃げる
They run off at the mere sight of me.

content: 3. (=さえ無くば)were it not for; had it not been for; but for...

content.content: この癖さえ無かったら善い人だが
Were it not for this fault,―But for this fault,―he would be a good man.
戦争さえ無かったらこんなに物価が上がるのではなかったろう

content: 4. (=までも)(not only...) but also; too

content:
