〈名〉To pole (a boat)

content.content: 小舟に棹差して川を渡った
I poled the back across the stream.
棹差して舟を出す
to push off

content:
さおだち〔竿立ち〕
〈名〉Rearing

content.content: 馬が竿立ちになる
A horse rears.

さおとび〔竿跳び〕
〈名〉Pole-jumping; vaulting:(一回なら)a pole-jump; a vault:(=する) to vault

さおばかり〔竿秤〕
〈名〉A steelyard

さおひめ〔佐保姫〕
〈固名〉The Goddess of Spring

content:
さか〔坂〕
〈名〉
1. A slope; an incline; a hill:(上り坂)an acclivity; an ascent:(鉄道のは)an up grade:(下り坂)a declivity; a descent:(鉄道のは)a down grade

content.content: 道が少し坂になっている
The road slopes a little.
坂を上る
to go up a slope―go uphill
坂を下る
to go down a slope―go downhill
坂の上に宮がある
There is a shrine at the head of the slope.
坂の下に鳥居がある
There is a torii at the foot of the slope.
手習いは坂に車を押す如く油断をすると後へ戻るぞ
He who learns to write pushes a cart uphill. Let him relax his efforts ever so little, and down be foes backward.
だらだら坂
a gentle slope
彼は五十の坂を越している
He is past fifty―gone fifty―turned of fifty―on the other side of fifty―on the wrong side of fifty―on the shady side of fifty.
まだ四十の坂を越さない
He is not yet forty―on this side of forty―on the right side of forty―on the sunny side of forty.

content:
さか〔茶菓〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: ちゃか〔茶菓〕

content:
さが〔祥〕
〈名〉An omen; a good omen

content.content: 浮世の祥
the hopes and fears of humanity

さが〔性〕
〈名〉
1. (=生れつき)one's nature
2. (=習わし)a custom; a habit

ざが〔座臥〕
〈名〉Sitting and lying; daily life

content:
さかい〔境〕
〈名〉A boundary; a border:(国境は)the frontier; the borders:(=する) to border (a country―on a country); to be bounded (by a river, etc.)

content.content: 朝鮮は満洲に境す
Korea borders on Manchuria.
鴨緑江は朝鮮と満洲の境をなしている
The Yalu forms a boundary between Korea and Manchuria.
浅間山は信州と上州の境にある
Mt. Asama rises on the borders of―rises between―Shinano and Kozuke.
満洲はシベリアと境を接している
Manchuria is contiguous to Siberia.
彼は生死の境にいる
He hangs between life and death―He stands on the brink of the river―His life hangs in the balance.

content:
さかうらみ〔逆恨み〕
〈名〉Mistaken anger

content.content: 下衆の逆恨み
He is angry with the man he has wronged.

content:
さかえ〔栄え〕
〈名〉Prosperity; glory

content.content: これらのことは皆国の栄えをなすものである
These things all conduce to the prosperity of the country.
神の栄え
the glory of God
神の栄えを表す
to glorify God
槿花一朝の栄
ephemeral grandeur

content:
さかえる〔栄える〕
〈自動〉To prosper; to flourish; to thrive; to do well:(形容詞に用いれば)prosperous; flourishing; thriving

content.content: 栄ゆる御代に逢うぞ嬉しき
I bless my star that I behold this prosperous reign.
一時は栄えた学校だ
The school flourished for a time.
彼の店は栄えている
His business is thriving―He is doing very well―He is driving a roaring trade.
悪人も一時は栄える
The wicked prosper for a time―“The devil's children have the devil's luck.”
悪人亡びて善人栄ゆ、めでたしめでたし
The wicked have fallen, and the good prosper. All is well that ends well.

さかかぜ〔逆風〕
〈名〉An adverse wind; a contrary wind; a foul wind; a head wind

さかき〔榊〕
〈名〉The sacred tree of Japan

content:
さがく〔差額〕
〈名〉The difference; the balance

content.content: 輸出入の差額
the balance of trade

content:
さかくせ〔酒癖〕
〈名〉Drinking habits

content.content: あの男は酒癖が悪い
He is a vicious drinker―quarrelsome in his cups.

さかご〔逆児〕
〈名〉A footling presentation; an agrippa

content:
さかさ〔逆さ〕
〈形〉Inverted; inverse; reverse; upside-down

content.content: 逆さ富士
Mt. Fuji as reflected in a lake.

さかさづめ〔逆さ爪〕
〈名〉An agnail; a hang-nail

さかさびょうぶ〔逆さ屏風〕
〈名〉A screen set upside down (around the deceased)

content:
さかさま〔逆様〕
〈形〉Inverted, inverse, reverse (order); contrary (result):(=に) upside down; the wrong side up; with the wrong end uppermost; headlong; head foremost; head over heels; topsyturvy; the wrong way; the other way; the other way about

content.content: 本の持ち方が逆様だ
You are holding your book upside down.
徳利を逆様にする
to turn a bottle upside down
世の中を逆様にする
to turn the worlds topsyturvy
西洋では何でも逆様だ
Everything is topsyturvy in foreign countries.
順序を逆様にする
to reverse the order―invert the order―put the cart before the horse
(飯を喰ってから湯に入る)そりゃ逆様だ
That's putting the cart before the horse.
猫の毛を逆様に撫でる
to rub a cat the wrong way
川が逆様に流れる
A river flows back―flows backward.
それでは並べ方が逆様だ
You have put the things the other way about.
鋒を逆様にして敵に付く
to go over to the enemy with one's arms reversed
箒を逆様に立てる
to stand a broom the wrong end up (as a charm to get rid of an unwelcome guest staying too long)
夢は逆様
“Dreams go by contraries.”
二人の言葉を逆様に解釈した
I interpreted their remarks by contraries.
彼は才子だ、逆様から
He is clever―over the left.
真逆様に
headlong―head foremost―head over heals
真逆様に水へ飛び込む
to plunge headlong into the water
一人の男が真逆様に三階から落ちた
A man tumbled head foremost―head over heels―from the third story.
人馬もろとも真逆様
Horse and rider rolled over the precipice.

content:
さかさまごと〔逆様事〕
〈名〉An inverted order of things

content.content: 逆様事ながらご忠告申す
I would advise you, though it is you who should advise me.

さかさまつげ〔逆さ睫〕
〈名〉Inverted eyelashes; trichiasis

content:
さがしあてる〔捜し当てる〕
〈他動〉To pitch upon (anything)

content.content: 君はちょうど好い人を探し当てたものだね
You have pitched upon the right man.

content:
さかしい〔賢しい〕
〈形〉Sagacious; shrewd

content.content: 女賢しうして牛売り損う
Female sagacity overreaches itself.

さがしい〔嶮しい〕
〈形〉Steep; precipitous

さかしお〔酒塩〕
〈名〉Sake seasoning (for Japanese soup)

content:
さがしだす〔捜し出す〕
〈他動〉To find out (anything); to search out (anything); to seek out, look out (a position); to hunt out, hunt up (a book); to rummage out (an old volume); to track out, ferret out (a criminal); to detect (a crime); to discover (a mistake)

content.content: 君のために好い地位を捜し出した
I have sought out―looked out―a good position for you.
倉の中からやっとこの本を捜し出した
I have hunted out―rummaged out―this volume in the godown.
彼の住所をやっと捜し出した
I have hunted out his abode.
草を分けても捜し出す
I will find him out if he be above ground.
また間違いを捜し出したね
So you have found out another mistake.
よく間違いを捜し出す男だ
You have a quick eye for mistakes.

content:
さがしまわる〔捜し廻る〕
〈他動〉To search about for (anything); to look about for (anything)

content.content: 方々捜しまわったけれども適当な人物が見当たらない
I have hunted up and down, but I can not find a suitable person.

content:
さがしもの〔捜し物〕
〈名〉The object of one's search; something missing

content.content: 雲をつかむような捜し物だ
It is a wild-goose chase.

ざがしら〔座頭〕
〈名〉The leading actor of a company:(女なら)the prima donna

content:
さがす〔捜す〕
〈他動〉
1. (=捜索する)to search for (anything); to look for (anything); to hunt for (a book); to drag for (a body); to grope for (the matches); to cast about for (the scent); to forage for (papers); to ransack (a drawer); to rummage (a drawer―in a drawer―among the papers); to try to find (anything)

content.content: 迷子を捜す
to search for a lost child
迷子を捜しに行った
We went in search of the lost child.
君は何を捜しているのか
What are you looking for?
眼鏡を捜している
I am looking for my spectacles.
捜しても無い
I have looked for them in vain―I can not find them.
捜す時は意地悪く見つからないものだ
When you look for anything, it will refuse to be found.
無いことがあるものか、よく捜せ
It must be there. Look well!
どこを捜してもありません
It is nowhere to be found.
彼はどこを捜してもいません
He is nowhere to be seen.
方々捜した
I have looked everywhere―hunted high and low.
家の中を捜す
to search the house―ransack the house―rummage the house
家の中をすっかり捜した
I have searched the house from top to bottom.
家宅捜索を行って書類を捜した
They searched the house for papers.
船へ臨検して密航者を捜す
to search a ship for stowaways
網を引いて死体を捜す
to drag the sea for bodies―sweep the river-bottom for a body
人を裸にして捜す
to search a man
人を裸にして所持品を捜す
to search a man for anything on his person
引き出しの中を捜した
I have ransacked the drawer―rummaged in the drawer―looked in the drawer.
あらゆる歴史から実例を捜した
I have searched all history for illustrations―dragged all history for illustrations―raked all history for illustrations.
手探りで捜す
to grope for―feel for―anything
暗闇でマッチを捜した
I groped for the matches in the dark.
血眼になって捜している、鵜の目鷹の目で捜している
They are looking with eager eyes.
鐘太鼓で迷子を捜した
We searched for the child with hue and cry.
そんな学者は当節は鐘太鼓で捜しても無い
Such scholars are not to be met with nowadays.
草を分けても捜す
I will find him out if he be above ground.
草を分け土を掘っても捜す
I will leave no stones unturned.
七度捜して人を疑え
You must be on sure ground before you accuse.
捜す当てが無い
I do not know where to look―I have no clue to guide me.

content: 2. (=求める)to seek for (employment); to look out for (a job); to try to find (anything)

content.content: 仕事を捜す
to seek for employment―look out for a job
彼は仕事を捜している
He is looking out for―on the lookout for―a job.
彼は仕事を捜しに上京したのだ
He has come to town in quest of employment.
彼は英語の先生の地位を捜している
He is looking out for―on the lookout for―a position as teacher of English.
僕は代りを捜している
I am looking out for―on the lookout for―a man to take my place.
下宿を捜す
to seek for lodgings
下宿を捜しに行った
I went in quest of lodgings.
あの学校では英語の先生を捜している
They are looking out for―on the lookout for―a teacher of English at that school―An English teacher is wanted at that school.
地図を捜す
to look for a place on a map―look up a place on a map
あの人を捜すのに暇が取れた
It took me time to find the man.
穴を捜す
to carp at faults―cavil at faults―peck at flaws
人の作などの穴を捜す
to pick holes in one's work―find faults in one's work

content:
さかずき〔盃〕
〈名〉
1. A wine-cup

content.content: 盃に酒を注ぐ
to fill a cup
盃を明ける
to empty one's cup―drain one's cup
盃をお明けなさい
Won's you empty your cup?
盃で飲む
to drink from a cup
盃を差す
to offer one a cup
盃を受ける
to accept a cup
盃をやりとりする
to exchange cups
盃をまわす
to pass the cup
お盃を頂戴
Pass me your cup!
盃や畳の模様じゃない
Your cup is not an ornament for the table.
迷った盃
a cup which has gone a-begging
別れの盃
a parting cup―a parting draught―a stirrup-cup―a grace-cup
三々九度の盃
a nuptial cup
色好まざらん人は玉の盃に底無きが如し
He who has no love for woman is like a cup without a bottom.

content: 2. (=儀式、婚礼)a ceremony; a marriage ceremony

content.content: 盃をする
to drink the nuptial cup―go through a marriage ceremony
親分子分の盃をする
to drink the cup of boss and follower
固めの盃をする
to exchange cups in token of pledge
夫婦の固めの盃をする
to exchange cups in token of marriage-vows

さかずきごと〔盃事〕
〈名〉A marriage ceremony; a wedding; a bridal; nuptials

content:
さかせる〔咲かせる〕
〈他動〉To make (a flower) bloom; to make (a tree) blossom

content.content: 枯木に花を咲かせる
to make a dead tree blossom
ひと花咲かせようと思う
I intend to make a noise in the world―create a sensation.
死に花を咲かせる
to die a glorious death―make a name in old age
けんかに花を咲かせた
The quarrel created a sensation.

ざかた〔座方〕
〈名〉The proprietor of a theatre

content:
さかだい〔酒代〕
〈名〉Drink-money

content.content: 彼が儲けた金は皆酒代になってしまう
All the money he earns goes in liquor.

content:
さかだち〔逆立ち〕
〈名〉Standing on one's head:(=になる) to stand on one's head

content.content: 君は逆立ちができるか
Can you stand on your head?
飛行機が逆立ちになる
An aeroplane lands on its nose.
君が逆立ちになって騒いでも駄目だ
No amount of efforts will be of any use―You may move heaven and earth, but in vain.

content:
さかだつ〔逆立つ〕
〈自動〉To stand on end; to bristle up

content.content: 髪が逆立つ
One's hair stands on end.

content:
さかだてる〔逆立てる〕
〈他動〉To bristle up

content.content: 彼女は柳眉を逆立てた
She bristled up (her fair eyebrows).
彼は髪を逆立てて怒った
He was in a towering passion.
鳥が羽根を逆立てる
A bird ruffles its feathers.

さかだる〔酒樽〕
〈名〉A wine-cask; a beer-barrel

content:
さかて〔酒手〕
〈名〉Drink-money

content.content: 昔は駕籠屋が酒手をねだったものだ
The coolies on the road used to demand drink-money of the travellers.
急いで行けば酒手をやる
Make haste, and I'll tip you.
さあこれをやるから酒手にしろ
Here is something for you to drink my health with.

content:
さかな〔肴〕
〈名〉
1. (=魚)fish

content.content: この近海は魚がたくさん取れる
Large quantities of fish is caught in these waters.
しけで魚が無い
No fish is to be had owing to stress of weather.
日本は魚が多い
Japan abounds in fish―The seas about Japan teem with fish.
逃がした魚は大きい
“A thing is the bigger for being lost.”
魚屋
a fish-monger

content: 2. (=下物)a relish (eaten with sake)

content.content: 酒と肴
eatables and drinkables
何か肴があるか
Have you anything to take with sake ?
こいつをなぶって肴にしよう
This fellow will serve to relish the wine.
酒の肴にはあっさりした物が好い
Light dishes go well with sake.

content:
さかなみ〔逆波〕
〈名〉A head-sea

content.content: 逆波が立っている
A head-sea is running.

さかにらみ〔逆睨み〕
〈名〉(A hired detective's) glance against his client

content:
さかねじ〔逆捩〕
〈名〉The biter bit; turning the table on one; a retort

content.content: 逆ねじを喰わす
to bite the biter―turn the tables on one―turn round on one―retort on one
彼は僕を咎めたから逆ねじを喰わしてやった
He found fault with me, so I turned the tables upon him.
逆ねじを喰う
to have the tables turned upon one―“go for wool and come back shorn”―“The biter is bit”

content:
さかのぼる〔溯る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=流れを溯る)to go up (a stream)

content.content: 河を溯って水源を探る
to trace a river to its source

content: 2. (=既往に溯る)to go back to (the past); to retrace (the past)

content.content: 原因に溯る
to retrace the cause―trace anything to its cause
本源に溯る
to retrace the origin―trace anything to its origin
本源に溯って習慣の由来を尋ねる
to trace a custom to its origin
人の系統を溯って先祖を調べる
to trace a person's pedigree to his ancestor
太古に溯る
to retrace remote antiquity
本源に溯る
to trace anything to its source or origin
既往に溯る
to go back to the past―retrace the past
法律に既往は溯らず
The law does not look back on the past―The law is not retrospective.
過去に溯る法律
a retrospective law

さかのり〔逆乗り〕
〈名〉(=自転車の逆乗り)Looping the loop:(=する) to loop the loop

content:
さかば〔酒場〕
〈名〉A bar; a bar-room; a tap-room:(米国にては)a saloon

content.content: 酒場の主人
a bar-keeper
酒場の女
a barmaid

さかばしら〔逆柱〕
〈名〉An inverted post

content:
さかびたし〔酒浸し〕
〈形〉(To be) steeped in liquor

content.content: 彼は一日酒浸しになっている
He is steeped in liquor all day.

さかぶくれ〔酒膨れ〕
〈形〉(To be) bloated with wine

content:
さかほ〔逆帆〕
〈名〉A sail driven aback

content.content: 船が逆帆を喰った
The ship was taken aback.

content:
さかまく〔逆捲く〕
〈自動〉To surge

content.content: 逆捲く波
surging waves
彼は逆捲く波の中へ飛び込んだ
He plunged into the boiling sea.

さかむけ〔逆剥け〕
〈名〉An agnail; a hang-nail

さかもぎ〔逆茂木〕
〈名〉An abatis

content:
さかもり〔酒盛〕
〈名〉A revel; revelry; a carousal; merry-making; a banquet; a drinking-bout; a convivial meeting; a convivial occasion; conviviality:(=する) to revel; to carouse; to make merry; to hold a banquet

content.content: 酒盛をして一夜を明かした
The night was passed in conviviality―The night was spent in revelry―We recelled all night―We made merry all night―We made a night of it.

content:
さかや〔酒屋〕
〈名〉A wine-shop; a wine-store:(人は)a wine-dealer

content.content: 酒屋へ三里豆腐屋へ二里
There is no human habitation within five miles of the place―It is five miles from anywhere.
あの男は酒屋の前を素通りすることができない
He has an unconquerable love for drink.

さかやき〔月代〕
〈名〉The shaven part of the head (in front of the topknot)

content:
さかゆめ〔逆夢〕
〈名〉A false dream

content.content: 夢は逆夢であった
My dream has turned out false.

さかよせ〔逆寄せ〕
〈名〉A sally; a sortie; a counter-attack

content:
さからう〔逆う〕
〈他動〉To oppose (one's will); to resist (an attempt); to contradict (one's statement); to gainsay (the truth); to disobey (orders); to act contrary to, act against (one's wishes); to run counter to (the spirit of the times); to go against (one's nature); to fly in the face of (justice, experience, Providence, etc.)

content.content: 汽船は風に逆らって走る
A steamer can run against the wind―in the teeth of the wind―in the wind's eye.
人の意に逆らう
to oppose one's will―act against one's wishes―act contrary to one's wishes
僕は自分の意に逆らって承諾した
I consented against my will.
兄弟が無いから意に逆らう者が無かった
Having no brothers or sisters, I had no one to oppose my will.
お前は親の意に逆らう気か
Do you mean to act against your parents' wishes?―act contrary to your parents' wishes?
親の意に逆らったのが悪い
You ought not to have disobeyed your parents.
彼は親の意に逆らって船乗りになった
He went to sea against his parents' wishes.
人情に逆らう
to go against human nature
天性に逆らうものでない
You should not act contrary to your nature.
真理に逆らうことはできぬ
There is no gainsaying the truth.
運命に逆らう
to strive against fate
天に逆らうとは無謀の冒険をすること
to fly in the face of Providence
時代精神に逆らう
to run counter to the spirit of the times
法律に逆らう
to resist the law―fly in the face of justice
人の言に逆らう
to contradict one's statement
彼に逆らうと立腹する
If you contradict him, you will offend him.
逆らわずに黙って聴いておれ
Listen to him without contradicting him!
病人の言うことに逆らうな
Humour an invalid!
流れに逆らって泳ぐ
to swim against the stream
世間の風潮に逆らうは難し
It is hard to swim against the stream.
船が潮流に逆らって進む
A ship stems the tide.
天下の大勢に逆らうことはできぬ
It is impossible to stem the tide of public opinion.

content:
さかり
〈名〉(=動物のさかり)(牡のは)rut:(牝のは)heat

content.content: さかりがつく
to rut―get on heat
さかりがついている
to be rutting―in heat
さかりがついた牝羊
a fulsome ewe
さかり時
rutting time―the period of heat

content:
さかり〔盛り〕
〈名〉Prime; height; summit; zenith; meridian; flower; bloom; flush; heyday; the golden age; one's palmy days; one's best days

content.content: 彼は今が盛りだ

He is seeing his best days―(は得意時代、男盛りなら)―in his prime―(繁栄の盛りなら)―at the height of his prosperity―at the summit of his prosperity―at the zenith of his prosperity―(人気の盛りなら)―at the height of his popularity.
男の盛りは四十
Forty is the prime of manhood.
彼は男盛りだ
He is in the prime of manhood.
日本人はいくつが男盛りか
When is a Japanese in his prime?
凡夫盛りに神崇り無し
“The gods have no power over a man in his prime.”
彼は盛りが過ぎた
He is past his prime―He has seen his best days.
女の盛りは三十
Thirty is the prime of womanhood.
彼女は女盛りだ
She is in the prime of womanhood.
若い盛り(娘盛り)だ
She is in the bloom of her youth―in the flower of her youth―in the flush of her youth.
彼は若い盛り(働き盛り)だ
He is in the heyday of his youth.
美しい盛りだ
She is in the prime of her beauty―in the meridian of her beauty.
あたら盛りの花を散らした
She was cut off in the flower of her youth.
盛りの花を野で暮らす
She “wastes her sweetness on the desert air.”
彼女は盛りが過ぎた(盛過ぎたる姥桜)
She is past her prime―superannuated.
真盛り
(花なら) to be in full bloom―in full flower―in full flush―(木の花なら)―in full blossom―(季節なら)―in the height of the season―in full swing―in full blast
花は今を盛りと咲いている
The flowers are in full bloom.
桜は真盛りだ
The cherry-trees are in full blossom.
菊は十一月が盛りだ
The chrysanthemums are in full flower in November.
海水浴は今が盛りだ
We are in the height of the sea-bathing season―Sea-bathing is in full swing.
銃猟は今が盛りだ
It is the height of the shooting season―Shooting is now in full blast.
日中の暑い盛りには仕事を休む
We lie by in the heat of day.
平安朝は日本文学の盛りであった
The Heian Period was the Golden Age of Japanese Literature.

content:
さがり〔下がり〕
〈名〉
1. (=下がること)falling; a fall; a descent
2. (=下落)a fall (in price); a decline (in price); depreciation
3. (=退出)going home from office or school

content.content: 学校のお下がりは何時ですか
What time do you come home from school?

content: 4. (=譲り物)one's cast-off things

content.content: お姉さんのお下がりを着ている
She is in her sister's cast-off clothes.

content: 5. (=身体のある部分の下がり)being set in a lower position than usual

さがりぐち〔下がり口〕
〈名〉A downward tendency (of the market); the decline (of price)

さかりば〔盛り場〕
〈名〉A public resort; a pleasure-resort; a holiday-resort

さがりふじ〔下がり藤〕
〈名〉Drooping wistaria-flowers

content:
さがりめ〔下がり目〕
〈名〉
1. Turned-down eyes
2.

content.content: 物価の下がり目
a downward tendency of the market

さかる
〈自動〉(=動物がさかる)To copulate

content:
さかる〔盛る〕
〈自動〉To prosper; to flourish; to thrive; to attract people

content.content: たいそう盛る所だ
The place attracts crowds of people.

content:
さがる〔下がる〕
〈自動〉
1. (=くだる)to go down; to come down; to descend; to fall; to drop

content.content: 一段下がる
to go down a step―come down a step
温度が下がる
The temperature falls―The temperature goes down.
体温が下がった
The temperature is lower.
体温が三十六度に下がった
The temperature has fallen to 36°.
熱が下がる
The temperature goes down―(熱病の熱なら)―Fever abates.
晴雨計がにわかに下がるのを見た
I observed the mercury fall suddenly.
位が下がる
to fall in rank―be degraded
月給が下がる
to have one's salary lowered
(試験で)何番下がる
to go down (by) so many seats
今度の試験で六番下がった
I have gone down six seats in the examination.
あまりのありがたさに思わず頭が下がる
I feel so grateful that I involuntarily bow my head.

content: 2. (=下落する)to fall; to go down; to decline; to depreciate

content.content: 物価が下がる
The prices fall―The prices go down―The prices decline.
物価が下がる方だ
The prices are declining―on the decline.
物価が下がった
The prices are down.
米が下がる
Rice falls in price―declines in price―depreciates.
米が下がった
Rice is down.
人の値打が下がる
A man falls ［sinks］ in the public estimation.
そんなことをしては君の値打が下がる
Such conduct will lower ［sink］ you in the public estimation.
そんなことをしては紳士の品格が下がる
It would be beneath the dignity of a gentleman―beneath a gentleman―to do such a thing.

content: 3. (=ぶらさがる)to hang; to hang down; to dangle

content.content: 入口に御神灯が下がっている
A lantern hangs at the entrance.
天井から何か下がっている
Something is hanging from the ceiling.
ぶらりと下がった程の好さ
How nicely it dangles!

content: 4. (=後へ下がる)to fall behind; to drop behind; to step back; to stand back

content.content: 群集を制して後へ下がらせる
to bear back the crowd
列から後へ下がる
to fall behind―drop behind
一歩後へ下がる
to take a step backward
びっくりして後へ下がった
I recoiled from the horrible sight.
下がりおろう
Stand back!

content: 5. (=退出する)to retire; to withdraw; to leave (one's office)

content.content: 御前を下がる
to retire from the Imperial presence―withdraw from the Imperial presence
君は何時に役所から下がるか
What time do you leave your office?―come home from office?
学校から下がるのは三時だ
I come home from school at three.
もう学校を下がった(退校した)
I have left school already.
嫁に行くのでお屋敷を下がった
She is going to get married, and has left her master's service.
宿へ下がる
A servant goes home.

content: 6. (=退歩する)to deteriorate; to retrograde; to fall off

content.content: 彼は学問が下がった
He has fallen off in his scholarship.
手が下がる
to fall off in one's skill―get out of practice
手が下がらないように始終練習している
I practice constantly to keep in practice―to keep my hands in.

content: 7. (=下付される)to be granted

content.content: 旅行免状が下がった
I have been granted a passport―obtained a passport.
鑑札が下がった
I have obtained the license.
指令が下がった
The petition is granted.

さかん〔佐官〕
〈名〉(陸軍のは)a field-officer:(海軍のは)a captain or a commander

content:
さかん〔左官〕
〈名〉A plasterer

content.content: まだ左官の仕事が残っている
The house remains to be plastered.

content:
さかん〔盛ん〕
〈形〉(=な) best, palmy (days); glorious (lot); grand (life); big (success); prosperous (business); flourishing (school); thriving (concern); roaring (banquet); successful (enterprise); vigorous, energetic (youth); active, brisk (trade); hearty, enthusiastic, rousing (welcome); raging (fire); sharp, spirited (contest); lively (imagination, etc.)

content.content: 盛んな学校だ
It is a flourishing school.
盛んな店だ
It is a prosperous firm―a thriving concern.
盛んな商売だ
He drives an active trade―a brisk trade―a roaring trade.
盛んな宴会だった
It was a roaring banquet.
盛んな事業だ
It is a successful enterprise.
盛んな歓迎を受けた
I had a hearty welcome―an enthusiastic welcome―a rousing welcome.
盛んな送別を受けた
I had a hearty send-off―a rousing send-off.
競争が盛んだ
There is a sharp competition―a spirited contest.
選挙競争が盛んだ
The election is sharply contested.
あの頃は英国の最も盛んな時代であった
Those were England's best days―palmy days.
米国は工業が盛んだ
The industries flourish in America.
信州は養蚕が盛んだ
Sericulture flourishes in Shinano.
外国貿易が盛んだ
Foreign trade is actively going on―in full swing.
ますます盛んだ
It goes on increasing.
密輸入が盛んだ
Smuggling is actively going on.
火事が盛んだ
A fire is raging.
暴風雨が盛んだ
A storm is raging―The storm is at its height.
その時は戦いが盛んだった
Then a battle was raging.
あの地方は政治熱が盛んだ
Politics run high in those parts.
あそこはキリスト教が盛んだ
Christianity is in great vogue there.
当節は自動車が盛んだ
Motoring is in great vogue―all the rage―all the mode―all the go―nowadays.
昨夜の会は盛んでしたか
Was the meeting a success?
非常に盛んな会でした
It was a big success.
僕は盛んな時は一升飲んだものだ
I used to drink my gallon in my day.
彼らは元気盛んなり
They are in high spirits―in high feather―in roaring health―(相撲や選手などなら)―in great form.
血気壮んなり
He is in the vigour of his youth―full of youthful vigour―Young blood riots in his veins.
血気壮んな青年
a vigorous youth―a lusty youth―a hot-blooded youth―(集合的に言えば)―young blood
老いてますます壮んなり
He enjoys a green old age.
その行を盛んにすべし
Give him a hearty send-off―Give him a rousing send-off.
まだ盛んですね
It is still actively going on―in all its vigour―(火事や嵐なら)―It is still raging.
盛んなる者は衰う
Prosperity is subject to decline.

content: 〈副〉(=に) actively; merrily; royally; at a great rate; like thunder; like steam; like fury; like sin; like fun; like wildfire; like the blazes; like the devil; like one o'clock; like anything

content.content: 彼は盛んに英語を研究している
He is actively engaged in studying English.
日本は米国と盛んに取引きする
Japan carries on an active trade with America.
世間は盛んに彼に同情している
Public sympathy is active in his behalf.
その問題は今盛んに詮議中だ
The question is under active discussion.
そんな風説が盛んに行われている
Such rumours are in active circulation.
女子教育が盛んに行われている
Female education is in great vogue.
新制度は盛んに行われている
The new system is in full operation―in full swing.
その習慣はまだ盛んに行われている
The custom is still strong.
舞踏はいまに盛んに行われるようになる
Dancing will soon be all the rage―all the mode―all the go.
彼は盛んに金を使う
He spends money royally.
盛んに遊ぶ
He takes his pleasure royally―goes on at a great rate.
盛んにやっている
He is going it strong―coming it strong.
盛んにやれ
Go it!―Go it like thunder!―Go it like the blazes!―Go it like the devil!―Go it like anything!
彼は盛んに働く
He works like steam―like sin―like anything.
盛んに売れ行く
The sale goes on marrily.
本は盛んに売れる
The book sells like fun―like wildfire―like anything.
盛に降っている、盛んに吹いている
It is raining and blowing like fury―like anything.
昨夜は盛んに飲んだ
We drank like anything―caroused―last evening.
馬車が盛んに走って通った
A carriage swept past.
自動車が盛んに走って通った
A motor-car flashed past.
家は盛んに燃えている
The house is in flames―in a blaze―The fire is raging.
火が盛んに燃えている
The fire is blazing up.
盛んに歓迎しようじゃないか
Let us give him a hearty welcome!―give him a rousing welcome!
盛んに送別しよう
We will give him a hearty send-off―give him a rousing send-off.

content:
さき〔左記〕
〈形〉Undermentioned; the following

content.content: 左記の物本社には一切関係無之候
We beg to notify the public that the undermentioned has no concernment with our firm.
左記の物品を御送付被下度候
Please send the following articles:―
左記の如し
They are as follows:―

content:
さき〔崎〕
〈名〉A promontory; a cape; a headland; a land's end; a point

content.content: 剣崎
Sword Point
崎をまわる
to double a cape

content:
さき〔先〕
〈名〉
1. (=尖端)the point (of a pin); the end (of a pole); the tip (of a finger); the tine (of a fork)

content.content: 先がとがっている
It is pointed―sharp at the end.
この鳥は舌の先がとがっている
Its tongue is sharp at the end―Its tongue has a sharp point.
その舌はだんだん細くなって先がとがっている
The tongue tapers to a point.
針の先
the point of a needle
剣の先
the point of a sword
小刀の先が折れた
The point of the knife is broken.
鉛筆の先
the point of a pencil
鉛筆の先をとがらす
to sharpen (the point of) a pencil
竿の先
the end of a pole
旗竿の先に金の玉が付いている
There is a golden ball at the top of the flagstaff.
尾の先に房になっている
The tail ends in a tuft.
葉巻の先を噛み切る
to bite off the end of a cigar
指の先
the tips of one's fingers―one's fingers' ends
爪の先
the tips of one's nails
爪の先まで似ている
They are alike to a hair.
大きな鷲は羽根の先から先まで二間もある
A large eagle will measure 12 feet from tip to tip of its wings.
その獣は鼻の先から尾の先まで六尺ある
The animal measures six feet from tip of nose to tip of tail.
その名が口の先まで出かかっていた
The name was on the tip of my tongue.

content: 2. (=順序の先、第一番)the first:(the latter に対し)the former:(=の) the first; the former:(=に) first; beforehand; forward:(前置詞に用いれば)before (the others); ahead of (the others); in advance of (the others)

content.content: (二人の名前が似ているから)先のと後のと間違いそうだ
I am afraid I shall mistake the former for the latter.
この本のうちどれから先に読みましょうか
Which of these books shall I read first?―Which of these books shall I begin with?
先に君の話をし給えそれから僕の話をする
Tell me your story first, and then I will tell mine.
先様お先
First come, first serves.
ご婦人からお先
Ladies first―The ladies must be served first.
国家を個人より先にする
to put the country before the individual
どうぞお先に
Please go first!―After you, sir!
お年頭からお先に
Age before youth!―(こっけいに言えば)―Age before honesty!―Age before respectability!
君先に行け僕は後から行く
Go on first, I will come after you.
お先失礼
Excuse my going first!―Dust before the broom!
僕は先に行くよ
I will go before you.
それではひと足お先に参ります
Then you will excuse my going before you.
うちの男を先にやっておいた
I have sent my man forward.
荷物は先に出した
My luggage was sent on beforehand.
彼は人よりも先に何でも覚える
He learns everything before the others―ahead of the others―in advance of the others.
我れ先に逃げた
It was everybody for himself and devil take the hindmost.
互いに先を争う
They contend for the first place―It is who shall be the first to do it.
先をくぐる
to forestall the others―get the start of the others―steal a march on the others
後になり先になり彼をつけた
I followed him, now ahead of him, now behind him.
後にも先にもたった一人の子だ
He was the only child they ever had.
話が後や先になる(話す言葉も後や先)
One gets confused in one's talk―One gets mixed up.
先に立つ
to lead the rest―lead the way―take the lead―precede the rest
校長が先に立って歩いた
The principal led the way.
東洋では日本が先に立って進む
Japan takes the lead in the East.
英語にては動詞が目的語の先に立つ
The English verb comes before the object―precedes the object.
皇族は華族の先に立つ
The Imperial family takes precedence of the nobility.
彼は僕の先に立って歩いた
He walked ahead of me―in advance of me.
涙が先に立つ
The tears will come into my eyes.
後悔先に立たず
Repentance always comes too late.
一番先に
first of all
一番先に来た人
the man who came first of all―(と言うよりも通例)―the first man who came.
田中が一番先に来た
Tanaka was the first man that came―the first man to came―the first to come.
彼は何でも一番先に始める
He is the first to begin anything―He takes the lead in everything.
一番先に開けた国はエジプト
Egypt was the first country to become civilized.
日本へ一番先に来たヨーロッパ人はポルトガル人
The Portuguese were the first Europeans to come to Japan.

content: 3. (=時の先なること)priority:(前置詞に用いれば)before (this); prior to (this); previous to (this):(=の) prior; previous:(=に) beforehand; in advance

content.content: これより先
before this―prior to this―previous to this
そういう場合には先に知らしておく
In that case, I shall let you know beforehand―notify you in advance.
彼は何でも人より先に始める
He begins everything before the others―ahead of the others―in advance of the others―He takes the lead―takes the initiative―in everything.
(後から苦情の出ないように)先に断っておく
I give you fair warning―give you due warning.

content: 4. (=時の先、過去)the past:(=の) the former; the late

content.content: 過ぎ去った先のことはしかたがない(既往は問わず)
We will let the past bury its dead―let bygones be bygones.
先の関白
the former Kanpaku―ex-Kanpaku
先の校長の時にあったことだ
It happened in the former principal's time―in the late principal's time.

content: 5. (=時の先、未来)the future:(=の) future; (time) to come

content.content: 先の事を考える
to think about the future
彼は先の考えが無い
He is thoughtless of the future.
先の事を予言する
to foretell the future
先の世
the future life
先が見える
He can see into the future―He has foresight.
先が見えぬ(お先真暗)
He can not see beyond his nose―He has no foresight.
先が案じられる
I fear for the future―I wonder what will become of me―It is a bad outlook for me.
こんなふうでは先が案じられる
This is a bad sign for the future.
これから先
after this―in future
この先どうしてよいやら
I do not know what to do in future.
先の見込
a future―an outlook―prospects
この事業は先の見込があるか
Has the enterprise a future?
先の見込は充分ある
It has a bright future before it.
先の見込が無い
It has no future.
先が見えている
The end is in sight―Its days are numbered.
先は先でどうかなる、先は先のことさ
Let the future take care of itself―The future will take care of itself.
一寸先は闇の世
The future is a sealed book―Life is not worth an hour's purchase.
飲めや歌えや一寸先や闇よ
“Eat and drink and make merry, for tomorrow you die.”
彼は先の無い身だ、先が短い
He has not long to live―He is not long for this world.
君らは(まだ若いから)先が長い
You have a long future before you.
もっと先へ行って説明する
I will explain farther on―later on.

content: 6. (=場所の先、前方)the front:(副詞に用いれば)(so many miles) off, ahead, farther on:(前置詞に用いれば)before (one); ahead of (one); in front of (one); beyond (a place)

content.content: これから先は山だ
There are mountains before us―ahead of us―in front of us.
これから先は歩こう
We will walk the rest of the way.
(真暗で)一寸先が見えぬ
We can not see an inch before us―can not see an inch ahead.
仙台は福島の先か手前か
Is Sendai beyond or this side Fukushima?
盛岡は仙台のずっと先だ
Morioka is far beyond Sendai.
そこは五マイル先だ
The place is five miles off―(歩きながら言えば)―five miles ahead―five miles farther on.

content: 7. (=話の先、後、続き)the rest; the sequel

content.content: あの話の先はどうなるのか
What is the sequel of the story?
先を読むとわかる
You will see by the sequel―(他動詞構文にすれば)―The sequel will show.
その話の先は(?)
Please go on with your story.
先は分かっている(後は言わずと知れたこと)
The rest needs no telling.

content: 8. (=行き先)one's destination; one's journey's end

content.content: 先へ着いたらご一報下さい
Write and let me know when you arrive (at your destination).
先が遠いから早く立つ
I start early as I have a long way to go.
彼は旅先で病気した
He fell ill while on a journey.
先がつかえている
The way is obstructed―The way is blocked―The way is barred.

content: 9. (=先方)the other party

content.content: 先で承知するかどうかわからん
There is no knowing if the other party will consent.
そりゃ先次第だ
It rests with the other party to decide.
先やさほどにも思やせぬのに
She does not care for me as I do for her.
人をお先に使う
to make a cat's paw of a man
働き先
one's place of employment
勤め先
one's office―one's headquarters

content:
さぎ〔詐欺〕
〈名〉Fraud; swindling:(一回なら)a swindle; imposture; cheating; a confidence game

content.content: こりゃ詐欺だ
This is fraud.
純然たる詐欺だ
It is a downright swindle.
詐欺で取った金だ
The money was obtained by fraud.
詐欺の廉をもって収監された
He was committed on a charge of fraud.
詐欺をする
to practise fraud―shark
彼は詐欺をして食っている
He sharks for a living.
詐欺にかける
to swindle a man―cheat a man―impose upon people―run a rig upon a man
詐欺にかかる
to fall a victim to fraud―be swindled
詐欺的
fraudulent
詐欺手段
fraudulent means―jugglery―trickery
詐欺手段で人の物をまき上げる
to defraud a man of his rights―swindle a man out of his money―swindle money from a man―cheat a man out of his money―juggle a man out of his possessions―trick a man out of his possessions
詐欺手段で金を取る
to obtain money by fraud―obtain money under false pretences
詐欺取財
obtaining money by fraud―obtaining money under false pretences
詐欺師
a swindler―an impostor―a sharper―a shark―a confidence man
詐欺破産
fraudulent bankruptcy
詐欺とばく
fraudulent gambling
詐欺とばくをする
to swindle at cards
詐欺とばくで金を取る
to rook a man
詐欺とばく師
a card-sharper―a rook

content:
さぎ〔鷺〕
〈名〉The heron

content.content: 鷺を烏と言いくるめる
to talk black into white
白鷺
the white heron―the egret
五位鷺
the night-heron
蒼鷺
the common heron

さきおととい〔一昨昨日〕
〈副〉The day but one before yesterday; three days ago; three days since; three days back

さきおととい〔一昨昨日〕
〈副〉The day but one before yesterday; three days ago; three days since; three days back

さきおととし〔一昨昨年〕
〈副〉The year but one before last; three years ago; three years since; three years back

さきおととし〔一昨昨年〕
〈副〉The year but one before last; three years ago; three years since; three years back

content:
さきがけ〔魁〕
〈名〉(事)the lead; the start; the initiative:(人)a leader; a pioneer:(=する) to be the first (to do anything); to take the lead (in anything); to take the initiative (in doing anything); to lead the van (of anything); to forestall (one); to get the start of (one); to steal a march on (one)

content.content: 彼は洋学のさきがけをした
He was the first to adopt Western learning―He took the lead in adopting Western learning―He was the pioneer of Western learning.
彼はいつも世を益することのさきがけをする
He always takes the lead―takes the initiative―in doing public good.
エジプトは文明のさきがけをした
Egypt was the first country to become civilized―Egypt led the van of civilization.
英仏は現今の文明のさきがけをしている
England and France are in the van of modern civilization.
彼は僕のさきがけをして先に学校を開いた
He forestalled me―got the start of me―stole a march on me―and started a school.
流行のさきがけをする
to set the fashion

さきがし〔先貸し〕
〈名〉Advancing:(=する) to advance (one money)

さきがち〔先勝ち〕
〈熟語〉First come, first served

さきがり〔先借り〕
〈名〉Borrowing in advance:(=する) to borrow (money) in advance

content:
さきくぐりする〔先潜りする〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: さきまわりする〔先廻りする〕

content.content: 先頃お約束した本を持って参りました
I have brought you the book I promised you the other day.
彼は先頃から上京している
He has been in town for some time.

content:

〈名〉
1. (=前々)the remote past
2. (=後々)the distant future

content.content: 彼は先々のことまで考える
He concerns himself about the distant future.
行く先々
the places where one goes
彼は行く先々で遊ぶ
He takes his pleasure wherever he goes.

さきさま〔先様〕
〈名〉The other party

content:

〈名〉A swindler; an impostor; a sharper; a shark; a confidence man

content.content: 詐欺師の食い物になる
to fall a prey to sharpers―fall a victim to fraud

さぎしゅざい〔詐欺取財〕
〈名〉Obtaining money by fraud; obtaining money under false pretences

content.content: あれは詐欺取財くらいはしかねない奴だ
He is quite capable of obtaining money under false pretences.

さきぞなえ〔先備え〕
〈名〉The van; the vanguard; the advanced guard

content:
さきそろう〔咲き揃う〕
〈自動〉To be all out

content.content: 花が咲き揃った
The flowers are all out―(木の花なら)―The blossoms are all out.

content:
さきだつ〔先立つ〕
〈他動〉To precede (the others); to go before, come before (something); to lead (a list); to head (a procession); to be antecedent to (an event); to be prior to (some action)

content.content: 英語にては動詞が目的語に先立つ
The English verb precedes its object―comes before its object.
思想は行動に先立つ
The thought is prior to the action.
楽隊が行列に先立った
A band headed the procession―led the procession―led the way.
彼は親に先立って死んだ
He preceded his parents in death―preceded his parents to the grave.
親に先立つ不幸の罪を赦して給え
My parents will forgive their undutiful child who goes to a better place before them.
子に先立たれる
to outlive one's child―survive one's child
僕だけ人に先立って出た
I had the start of the others.
出発に先立って訪問したい人がある
I want to call on some people before I leave―prior to my departure.
先立つものは金
Money is always the first consideration.
先立つものは涙ばかり
The tears will come into my eyes.

さきて〔先手〕
〈名〉The van; the vanguard; the advanced guard

さきどなり〔先隣り〕
〈形〉Next-door but one (to a house)

content:
さぎとばく〔詐欺賭博〕
〈名〉Fraudulent gambling; swindling at cards

content.content: あの男は詐欺とばくをやる
He swindles at cards.
詐欺とばくで金を取る
He will rook people.
詐欺とばく師
a card-sharper―a rook

さきどり〔先取り〕
〈名〉Taking in advance:(=する) to take (anything) in advance

content.content: 先取特権
a preferential right

〈名〉
1. (=前世)the previous existence; the previous life
2. (=後の世)the future life; the next world

〈名〉An outrider

さきばしり〔先走り〕
〈名〉
1. (=先駆)a forerunner; a precursor
2. (=出過ぎ者)an impertinent fellow:(=する) to be impertinent; to put oneself forward

さきばしる〔先走る〕
〈自動〉To put oneself forward; to be forward, be impertinent, be bumptious, be self-assertive

content:
さきばらい〔先払〕
〈名〉
1. (=届け先払)payment on delivery; charge forward:(=する) to pay on delivery

content.content: 賃銭先払
carriage forward
郵税先払
postage forward

content: 2. (=前払)payment in advance:(=する) to pay in advance

content.content: 下宿料は先払いしてある
My board has been paid in advance.
下宿料は先払いのこと
Board is payable in advance.

content:
さきひづけ〔先日付〕
〈名〉Antedating:(=する) to antedate (a letter)

content.content: 手紙は先日付がしてある
The letter is antedated.

content:
さきぶれ〔先触れ〕
〈名〉(事)a previous announcement:(人)a herald; a harbinger; a forerunner; a precursor:(=する) to announce beforehand; to herald; to harbinger; to fore-run

content.content: 幾日も前から先ぶれがあった
It was announced day's beforehand.
大袈裟な先触れであった
It was announced with a flourish of trumpets.
できは先ぶれほどでない
The performance falls short of the announcement.
彼の著述は傑作だという先ぶれであった
His work was heralded as a masterpiece.

content:
さきぼう〔先棒〕
〈名〉
1. (=駕籠の先棒)the foremost bearer (of a sedan-chair)
2. (=人のお先に使われる物)a cat's paw

content.content: 人を先棒に使う
to make a cat's paw of a man
先棒に使われる
to be made a cat's paw of
先棒を振る
to lead the dance―lead the ball

content:
さきほこる〔咲き誇る〕
〈自動〉To bloom in all its beauty; to bloom in all its glory

content.content: 菊が咲き誇っている
The chrysanthemums are blooming in all their beauty.
桜が咲き誇っている
The cherry-trees are blossoming in all their glory.

content:
さきほど〔先程〕
〈副〉A while ago; a little while ago

content.content: 先程お帰りになりました
He returned a little while ago.

さきまわりする〔先廻りする〕
〈自動〉To forestall (the others); to get the start of (the others); to steal a march on (the others)

content:
さきみだれる〔咲き乱れる〕
〈自動〉To riot; to run riot

content.content: 桜が咲乱れている
The cherry-blossoms are running riot.
今を盛りと咲乱れている
They are rioting in all their glory.

content:
さきもの〔先物〕
〈名〉Futures

content.content: 先物を売買する
to deal in futures
先物売買
forward bargain―arrival sale
先物約定
forward contract
先物値段
forward price

さきゅう〔砂丘〕
〈名〉A dune; a down

content:
さぎょう〔作業〕
〈名〉Work; operations

content.content: 作業を開始する
to commence operations
作業を停止する
to suspend operations―Work is suspended
引上げ作業
salvage operations
作業場
a workshop―works
囚人の作業
prison-task
軍隊の作業
fatigue-duty
作業服
fatigue-dress

content:
ざきょう〔座興〕
〈名〉Amusement of the company; entertainment of the company

content.content: ただ座興にそう言ってみたのさ
I only said so to amuse the company.
座興にいろいろな芸をした
Various feats were performed for the entertainment of the company.

content:
ざぎょう〔坐業〕
〈名〉A sedentary occupation

content.content: 坐業者
a sedentary―a man of sedentary habits

さきわけ〔咲分け〕
〈名〉Variegated flowers

content.content: 咲分けのツツジ
an azalea with variegated flowers

さきわたし〔先渡し〕
〈名〉Future delivery; forward delivery

さきん〔砂金〕
〈名〉Gold dust; alluvial gold

content.content: 砂金を含む砂
placer
砂金採集
alluvial mining―placer mining

content:
さきんずる〔先んずる〕
〈他動〉To forestall; to anticipate; to get the start of (one); to steal a march on (one); to be beforehand with (one); to take the lead; to take the initiative

content.content: 敵に先んずる
to forestall the enemy―anticipate the enemy―anticipate an attack
Darwin は Maurice に先んじて進化論を世に出した
Darwin stole a march on Maurice, and set forth his evolution theory.
相手に先んじられた
My companion forestalled me―got the start of me―stole a march on me―My companion was beforehand with me.
日本はロシアに先んじて勝った
Japan had the start of Russia, and won.
先んずれば人を制す
He wins who gets the start.
彼は何事も人に先んずる
He takes the lead―takes the initiative―in everything.
彼は世に先んじた思想を抱いている
He is ahead of his age.
人の言わんとすることを先んじて言う
to take the words out of one's mouth―take the wind out of one's sails

content:
さく〔割く〕
〈他動〉
1. To cut up

content.content: 牛を割く
to cut up an ox
牛刀をもって鶏を割く
to cut up a fowl with a cleaver―“employ a steam-hammer to crack a nut”―“break a butterfly upon the wheel”
時間を割く
to spare time (from something to do something)
本務の時間を割いて著述をした
I spared time from my business to write a book.
そんなことに時間を割くことができぬ
I can not spare time―I have no time to spare―for such purposes.
国を割く
to cede a territory―alienate a territory―(to a power)
国を割いても平和
peace on any terms―dishonourable peace

content:
さく〔咲く〕
〈自動〉
1. To open; to flower; to bloom:(木の花なら)to blossom:(薔薇などなら)to blow

content.content: 花が咲く
Flowers bloom―(木なら)―Trees blossom―(すべての植物に言えば)―Plants flower.
菊は秋咲く
The chrysanthemum blooms in autumn.
桜は四月初に咲く
The cherry-tree blossoms at the beginning of April.
花が咲いた
The flowers are blooming―The flower are open―The flowers are out.
菊が咲いた
The chrysanthemums are blooming―in bloom―flowering―in flower.
桜が咲いた
The cherry-trees are blossoming―in blossom―The cherry-blossoms are out.
桜は二三分通り咲いた、三四分通り咲いた、七八分通り咲いた
The cherry-blossoms are peeping out―The cherry-blossoms are nearly half out―The cherry-blossoms are mostly out.
花咲いて風雨多し
When the cherry-blossoms are out, so are the storms.
咲いた花
a blooming flower―an open flower
咲いた桜
a blossoming cherry-tree
咲いた桜に
Why tie thy steed
何故駒繋ぐ
To a blossoming cherry-tree?
駒が勇めば
The horse will prance,
花が散る
The blossoms scattered be.
咲いた薔薇
a blown rose
咲きかけた花、咲き立ての花
an opening flower
花が咲き出した
The flowers are opening.
桜が咲き出した
The cherry-trees are beginning to blossom―The cherry-blossoms are opening.
梅がチラホラ咲き出した
The plum-blossoms are opening by twos and threes―The plum-blossoms are peeping out here and there.
けんかに花が咲いた
The quarrel created a sensation.
話に花が咲く
The talk becomes animated.
女やもめに花が咲く
A widow will look smart.
煎豆に花が咲く
You might as well expect parched beans to flower.
また花の咲く時もあろう
I may again be at the top of Fortune's wheel.

content:
さく〔作〕
〈名〉
1. (=農作)cultivation of land; tillage of the soil

content.content: 作をする
to cultivate land―till the soil

content: 2. (=作物)a crop; a harvest; a yield

content.content: 一番作、二番作
the first crop―the second crop
米作はどうか
How is the rice-crop?
米は満作だ
We have a full rice-crop.
豊作だ
We have a rich harvest of rice.
平作だ
We have a normal yield of rice.
半作だ
We have a half-crop of rice.
不作だ
We have a bad rice-crop.
凶作だ
We have a failure of rice-crop―The rice-crop has failed.
作が当たる
A crop turns out well.
作がはずれる
A crop fails.

content: 3. (=著作)a work; a literary work; a production (of one's pen)

content.content: 君は紅葉の作を読んだか
Have you read any of Koyo's works?
この詩は誰の作か
By whom was this poem written?
西郷隆盛の作だ
It was written by Saigo Takamori―It is by Saigo Takamori―It is from the pen of Saigo Takamori.
西郷隆盛の作だという
It is said to have been written by Saigo Takamori―ascribed to the pen of Saigo Takamori.
これは古人の作だ
This is a work of one of the ancients―This is by one of the ancients.
これは得意の作だ
This is my pet and darling work.
折りに触れての作
an occasional piece
これは彼の処女作だ
This is his maiden effort.

content: 4. (=製作品)a piece of work; a production; a performance

content.content: これは実に偉い作だ
It is a wonderful piece of work―a masterpiece.
この絵は誰の作か
By whom was this picture painted?
雪舟の作だ
It was painted by Sesshu―It is by Sesshu―It is from the brush of Sesshu.
雪舟の作だという
It was ascribed to the brush of Sesshu.
Rubens の作だという
It is ascribed to the pencil of Rubens.
この像は誰の作か
By whom was this image carved?
左甚五郎の作だ
It was carved by Hidari Jingoro―It is by Hidari Jingoro―It is from the chisel of Hidari Jingoro.
左甚五郎の作だという
It is ascribed to the chisel of Hidari Jingoro.
この刀は誰の作か
By whom was this sword made?―forged?
正宗の作だ
It was made by Masamune―forged by Masamune―It is by Masamune―from the forge of Masamune.
正宗の作だという
It is ascribed to the forge of Masamune.
銘を打った作
a work bearing the maker's［painter's, sculptor's］signature
無銘の作
an anonymous work

content: 5. (=製作法)workmanship

content.content: この仏像は作が好い
This Buddhist image is of fine workmanship.
作の点ではこれに並ぶものが無い
It has no equal in (point of) workmanship.

content:
さく〔柵〕
〈名〉A paling; a palisade; a stockade

content.content: 柵を結う
to make a palisade―throw up a stockade
柵をめぐらす
to enclose the grounds with a palisade―palisade the grounds
屋敷には鉄柵をめぐらしてある
The grounds are surrounded with an iron paling.

content:
さく〔策〕
〈名〉A scheme; a plan; a course; a way; an expedient; a policy; a shift; resort; resources; means; measures; steps

content.content: そこで一策を案じた
Thereupon I thought of a plan.
策をめぐらす
to revolve a scheme―devise a scheme―contrive a scheme―concoct a scheme
彼は一策をめぐらして政権を握った
He assumed the reins of government by a stroke of policy.
策を講ずる
to devise some means―find some means―cast about for some means
策を施す
to take measures―(は公の策、私の策なら)―take steps
どうか策を施さねばならぬ
We must take some measures―take some steps―do something.
断然たる策を施す
to take decisive measures―take the bull by the horns
策の施しようが無い、施すべき策無し
I am at a loss how to act―I am at the end of my resources―I am at my wits' end.
そうするよりほかに施すべき策無し
There is no other resource―There is nothing for it but to do so―There is no alternative.
逃げるよりほかに策が無い
I have no resource but to fly―Flight is my only resource―There is nothing for it but to fly.
策に窮した、策が尽きた
I am at the end of my resources―at my wits' end―at the end of my tether―put to my shifts―I have played my last card.
彼は策に富む
He is fertile in resources―full of resource.
策に富む人
a man of resources
策を弄す
to scheme
あの男は策を弄する
He is a schemer―fond of scheming―given to scheming.
慾張るのは策の得たるものでない
It is bad policy―impolitic―inexpedient―unwise―to go beyond bounds.
控え目にするのが策の得たるものだ
It is good policy―politic―expedient―wise―to keep within bounds.
それが策の最も得たるものだ
That is the best policy.
正直にするのが策の最も得たるものだ
Honesty is the best policy.
それが上策だ、良策だ
That is good policy―a good plan.
最上の策だ、最良策だ
That is the best policy―the best course―the best way.
時機に投じたる策というべし
It must be pronounced a most opportune scheme.
万全の策
a safe plan―a sure means
窮策
a shift―the last shift―the last resource―the last expedient
窮策を用いる
to be put to one's shifts
弥縫策
a temporary expedient―a makeshift
善後策
remedial measures
善後策を講ずる
to devise remedial measures
金策
ways and means of raising money
金策をする
to raise money
離間策
mischief-making
離間策を施す
to make mischief
老朽淘汰策
scrap-heap policy

content:
さく〔裂く〕
〈他動〉
1. To tear; to rend; to split; to cleave; to rip

content.content: 着物を裂く
to tear one's clothes
着物をビリビリ裂く
to rip one's clothes
手紙を裂く
to tear up a letter
その手紙をふんだくって細々に裂いた
I snatched the letter from him and tore it to pieces.
手帳の紙を一枚裂き取る
to tear a leaf off a note-book
手拭を裂いて包帯した
I tore up my handkerchief into strips, and bandaged the wound.
真二つに裂く
to rend in two―split in two―cleave in twain
木に落雷して真二つに裂いた
The tree was struck by lightning and cleft in twain.
手足を八つ裂きに裂く
to tear one limb from limb
二人の仲を裂く
to alienate―estrange―sever―come between―two people
親子の仲を裂く
to alienate father from son
友人の仲を裂く
to estrange friends―estrange friend from friend
夫婦の仲を裂く
to sever husband from wife―sever husband and wife
人々の仲を裂く
to make mischief
彼は人の仲を裂くのが道楽だ
He is a mischief-maker―He takes a malicious pleasure in setting people at variance―setting people at odds―setting people by the ears.
女に男の悪口を言って仲を裂こうとする(水を注す)者がある
Somebody has poisoned her mind against him.
友情の冷却する事情があって二人の仲が裂かれた
Some coldness came between the two friends.

content:
さくい
〈形〉
1. (=もろい)brittle; fragile

content.content: さくい木
soft wood

content: 2. (=気さくな)frank; open-hearted

content.content: ずいぶんさくい人だ

content.content: 作為犯

content.content: 本に索引を付ける

content.content: 海陸策応して旅順を攻めた
The navy cooperated with the army in attacking Port Arthur―The army attacked Port Arthur in cooperation with the navy.
海軍の運動は陸軍と策応した
The movements of the navy were coordinated to those of the army.

さくおとこ〔作男〕
〈名〉(A farmer's) man; a farm-hand

content:
さくがく〔錯愕〕
〈名〉Alarm; dismay

content.content: 錯愕色を失う
to turn pale in alarm
錯愕為すところを知らず

content:
さくがら〔作柄〕
〈名〉
1. (=農作物の模様)the crop; the crop situation

content.content: 作柄はどうか
How is the crop (situation)?
作柄報告
a crop-report

content: 2. (=製作の模様)workmanship

さくがんき〔鑿岩機〕
〈名〉A rock-drill

content:
さくぐ〔索具〕
〈名〉Rigging

content.content: 船に索具を取付ける
to rig a ship

content:
さくげん〔削減〕
〈名〉Reduction; retrenchment; curtailment:(=する) to reduce; to retrench; to curtail; to cut down

content.content: 経費を削減する
to retrench the expenditure―curtail the expenses―cut down the expenses
予算案は議会で削減された
The Budget was reduced by the Diet.

content:
さくげんち〔策源地〕
〈名〉The base of operations

content.content: 支那が過激派運動の策源地となる恐れがある
There are apprehensions of China becoming the base of Bolshevik movement.

content:
さくご〔錯誤〕
〈名〉An error; a mistake

content.content: 錯誤に陥る
to fell into error
時代錯誤

content:
さくさく〔嘖々〕
〈副〉Highly (renowned, etc.)

content.content: 本書一度出るや好評嘖々たり
On its appearance, the present work was received with high favour―accorded a highly favourable reception.
氏は名声嘖々たり
He is highly reputed―He enjoys a high reputation.

content.content: 桜が咲く
The cherry-tree blossoms.
桜が咲いた
The cherry-trees are in blossom―The cherry-blossoms are out.
桜が満開だ

桜は咲き誇っている
The cherry-trees are blossoming in all their glory.
桜は咲き乱れている

桜は二三分通り咲いた

桜は三四分通り咲いた

桜は八九分通り咲いた
The cherry-blossoms are mostly out.
桜が散る

桜はもう散った
The cherry-blossoms are over.

content:
さくりゃく〔策略〕
〈名〉An artifice; a device; a trick; a ruse; a policy; a scheme; a design; a plan; a stratagem; strategy; tactics; resources; manoeuvre

content.content: 策略を用いる、策略を施す
to resort to artifice―manoeuvre
策略をもって人を釣り出す
to lure a man by artifice
策略をめぐらす
to revolve a scheme―devise a scheme―form a design―lay a plan
彼は策略に富む
He is fertile in resources―full of resource.
策略に富む人
a man of resources
あれは我々に油断をさせる策略だ
It is a ruse to throw us off our guard.
あれは人心を得る策略だ
It is a policy to win the hearts of people.
あれは人をだます策略だ
It is a trick to cheat people.
策略に陥る
to fall into a snare―walk into a trap
人の策略にかかる
to fall a victim to one's schemes
策略が図に当たった
The stratagem took.
策略がはずれた
The stratagem failed.
策略が尽きた
I am at the end of my resources―at my wits' end.
策略家
a schemer―a tactician―a man of resources―a designing woman

content:
さぐる〔探る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=手探りで捜す)to feel for, grope for, fumble for (anything)

content.content: ポケットの中を探ってみた
I felt in my pocket―fumbled in my pocket.
懐の財布を探ってみると無い
I felt for my purse in my pocket―it was gone.
暗中物を探る
to grope for anything in the dark
暗闇を探り探り行った
I groped my way―felt my way―in the dark.
(骨相学者が頭の)隆起を探る
to feel for the bumps
嚢中物を探るが如し
I am sure of my game.

content: 2. (=探索する)to search for (anything); to trace; to track

content.content: 根源を探る
to trace the origin
その根源を探ると仏教から出ている
Its origin can be traced back to Buddhism.
人の経歴を探る
to trace a man's career
河を溯って水源を探る
to trace a river to its source
行方不明になった船の跡を探る
to trace the track of a missing ship
人の行った跡を探る
to track out one's course
探海灯で海面を探る
to sweep the sea (with a search-light)

content: 3. (=探知する)to search (one's heart); to sound (one's views); to feel (the ground); to pry into, spy into (secrets); to inquire into (facts); to probe (the matter)

content.content: 人の心を探る
to search one's heart―sound one
彼は人の心を探るような目で人の顔を見る
He will cast a searching glance on you.
人の意(意中、意向、意見)を探る
to sound one's views―sound one on the subject―feel one's pulse―feel one on the subject―feel out one's views―throw out a feeler
遠まわしに人の意向を探る
to beat about the bush
世間の意向を探る
to feel the pulse of the public―fly a kite
政界や外交界などの意向を探る
to fly a ballon d'essai
人の秘密を探る
to pry into one's secrets―spy into one's secrets
事実を探る
to inquire into facts
事情を探る
to inquire into the state of affairs
内情を探る
to inquire into the actual state of matters―get behind the scenes
様子を探る
to inquire into the state of affairs―see how the land lies―find out how the wind lies
地勢を探る
to feel the ground
事を深く探る、充分に探る
to probe the matter to the bottom

content: 4. (=探診する)to probe; to sound; to explore

content.content: 傷を探る
(探針を用いてなら) to probe a wound―sound a wound―(探針を用いずになら)―explore a wound
痛くない腹を探られる
to be falsely accused―placed in a false position

content: 5. (=探検する)to explore

content.content: 蛮地を探る
to explore a savage country
名所を探る
to see the sights
古跡を探る
to visit places of historic interest
秋の日高尾の紅葉を探る
One autumn day, I went to see the maples of Takao.

content: 6. (=探偵する)to spy on (one's movements); to track (a criminal); to trace (a crime)

content.content: 人の動静を探る
to spy on one's movements
犯人を探る
to track the culprit
罪跡を探る
to trace a crime
犯人の踪跡を神戸まで探り得た
The culprit has been traced as far as Kobe.

content: 7. (=偵察する)to reconnoitre; to scout

content.content: 敵の動静を探る
to reconnoitre the enemy's movements
敵情を探る
to feel the enemy―feel for the enemy―scout
大将自ら敵情を探りに出かけた
The general went out scouting in person.

content.content: 北海道では鮭がたくさん取れる
Large quantities of salmon are caught in the seas about Hokkaido.
塩鮭
salted salmon
塩の辛い鮭
strongly salted salmon

content:
さけ〔酒〕
〈名〉
1. Wine; liquor; drink; strong drink; an intoxicating liquor; the bottle; the cup

content.content: 酒を造る
to brew sake
酒を飲む
to drink (wine)―regale oneself with liquor―moisten one's clay
お父様はお酒を召上がりますか
Does your father drink?
酒は一滴も戴きません
He does not drink a drop of wine―He never touches wine.
あの人は大酒を飲む
He drinks heavily―drinks hard―drinks like a fish―drinks like a whale.
彼らは朝から晩まで酒ばかり飲んでいる
They do nothing but drink from morning till night.
決して酒を飲むな
Never taste strong drink!
僕は酒を口にしたことが無い
I never tasted strong drink in my life.
酒を飲まないという約束をした
I have promised never to taste strong drink.
酒を腹いっぱい飲む
to drink one's fill
空腹に酒を飲む
to drink on an empty stomach
酒は空腹に飲むと利く
Wine tells on an empty stomach.
酒を飲むなら控え目に飲め
If you do drink, drink sparingly.
酒を飲むなら程に飲め
If you do drink, drink in moderation.
花は半開酒はほろよい
Moderation is the soul of enjoyment.
酒をガブガブ飲む
to swing liquor―swill liquor
酒をチビチビ飲む
to tipple
彼はクビリクビリと酒を飲んでいた
He was drinking in silence.
酒を浴びる
to booze―soak
酒にひたる
to be steeped in liquor―drowned in wine
平素酒を嗜む
He is a habitual drinker.
彼はいつも酒臭い
He always smells of wine.
酒に飲まれる
to drink away one's reason
酒は飲むべし飲まるべからず
You may drink wine, but you must not drink yourself drunk.
彼はいくら酒を飲んでも平気だ
Wine has no effect on him.
酒は飲み放題
You may drink as much as you like―You will have the run of the cellar.
酒を一本飲みながら相談した
We discussed the matter over a bottle of wine.
彼は酒を飲みながらその話をした
He told the story over his cup.
彼は酒を飲むと冗談を言う
He is merry over his cups.
酒を飲んで苦労を忘れる(酒に苦労をまぎらす)
to drown care in wine
酒を飲んで悲しさをまぎらす
to drink down sorrow
酒を飲んで売買相談をまとめる
to wet a bargain
酒を飲んで騒ぐ
to make merry―go on the spree
彼は酒を飲んで暴れる
He gets drunk and commits excesses.
酒を飲むと癖が出る
A man shows himself in his cups.
酒は本心を表す、酒の酔い本性を表す
“The heart is seen in wine”―“There is truth in wine”―“Wine reveals the true man”―“The true man come out in drink.”
人を知るは酒が近道
Wine is the nearest way to knowledge of character.
酒飲めばいつか
Wine maketh glad the heart of man,
心も春めきて
And makes of winter genial spring;
借金取りも
And e'en the bill-collecting dun
鶯の声
Doth to me like a robin sings.
酒を飲ませる
to let one drink―make one drink―regale one with liquor―treat one to liquor―prime one with liquor
彼らに酒でも飲ましてやれ
Regale them with liquor!
彼は沈んでいるから酒でも飲まして元気をつけてやれ
He seems in low spirits. Prime him with liquor and cheer him up!
彼に酒を飲ませるな
Do not let him drink!―Prevent him from drinking!―Keep him from the bottle!
否応無しに飲ましてやる
I will make him drink whether he will or not.
彼は金持ちになってうまい酒が飲める
He has made a fortune, and can afford to indulge his testes.
そうすりゃうまい酒が飲めようという寸法さ
I expect to make a good thing out of it.
この酒はちょっと飲める
This wine drinks well.
この酒は値段にしては飲める
This wine drinks well for its price.
酒に酔う
to get drunk (on wine)―become intoxicated (on wine)―yield to the influence of wine
彼は酒に酔っている
He is drunk―intoxicated―in drink―in liquor―disguised in liquor―the worse for liquor―under the influence of wine.
彼は酒に酔ってそんなことを言ったのだろう
He must have said so under the influence of wine.
あの相撲が負けたのは酒にでも酔っていたのだろう
He must have been the worse for liquor.
酒に酔って水へ入るな
Do not get into the water when you are drunk.
飲んだ酒なら酔わずばなるまい
Why should not wine make me drunk?
この酒は頭へ上がる
This wine gets into the head.

content:
4. 
〈その他〉

content.content: 彼は酒が好きだ
He is fond of wine―He is a thirsty soul.
酒が好きで止められない
He has an unconquerable love for wine―He is an inveterate drinker.
彼は酒の奴隷だ
He is a slave to the cup.
彼は酒が強い
He is a good drinker―He has a large capacity for wine.
彼は酒が弱い
I am a poor drinker―I have no capacity for liquor.
酒を始める
to take to drinking
人は無事に苦しむと酒やばくちを始める
When a man has nothing to do, he will take to drinking and gambling.
悪いことは酒から始まる
Drinking leads to other vices.
酒を止める
to give up drinking―swear off drinking
酒を止めた
I have given up drinking―drunk my last cup.
彼は医者の注意も聴かずに酒を止めぬ
He keeps on drinking in defiance of his doctor's warning.
彼は好きな酒をさらりと止めた
He has wholly given up his favourite cup.
酒を絶つ
to abstain from wine―go dry
酒を絶つ誓いを立てた
I am under a vow to abstain from wine.
彼は主義として酒を絶っている
He abstains from wine on principle―He is a teetotaller.
米国では酒を禁じた
They have prohibited the use of intoxicating liquors in America―The Americans are going dry.
酒にふける
to addict oneself to drinking―indulge (too freely) in wine
彼は酒にふけっている
He is addicted to drinking―given to dissipation.
酒を出す
to provide wine―serve wine―offer one wine
酒が出る
Wine makes its appearance.
酒が出ている
Wine is on the table.
酒を注ぐ
to fill one's cup
酒の相手をする
to take wine with one
酒の相手をしてくれんか
Will you take wine with me?
酒のお相手をしてもよろしい
I don't mind taking a cup of wine with you.
女将に酒の相手をして貰った
I asked the landlady to take wine with me―I requested her company over the wine.
彼は酒の上が悪い
He is a vicious drinker―quarrelsome in his cups.
酒の上が好い
He is a harmless drinker.
酒の上で冗談を言う
He is merry in his cups.
酒の上でけんかをした
They quarrelled over their cups.
酒の上のけんか
a drunken brawl
酒の上の勇気
Dutch courage―pot-valour.
あの男は酒の勇気だ
He is pot-valiant.
酒の上で行き違いが起こった
A difference arose over their cups.
酒の上とは言いながらあんなことをしては言い訳が立たぬ
Granting that he was drunk, that is no excuse for his behaviour.
それは酒の上で言ったのだろう
He must have said so under the influence of wine.
酒とタバコは養生に害あり
Wine and tobacco are injurious to health.
彼の病気は酒がもとだ
Wine is at the bottom of his illness―Wine is at the root of his illness.
彼は今に酒に命を取られるぞ
He will drink himself to death.
酒と女
wine and woman―dissipation and debauchery
とかく浮世は色と酒
Wine and woman rule the world.
酒無くて何の己が桜かな
What is the cherry-blossom without wine?
肉積んで山を成し酒流れて河を成す
There were mountains of meat and oceans of wine.
酒は百薬の長
Wine is the chief of all medicines.
酒は憂の玉箒{たまははき}
“Wine maketh glad the heart of man.”
酒は天の美禄
Wine is Heaven's boon to man.
酒は気違い水
“Drunkenness is a voluntary madness”―“When the wine is in, the wit is out.”

さげかざり〔下げ飾〕
〈名〉A pendant

さげがみ〔下げ紙〕
〈名〉A tag:(手形に付けるのは)an allonge

さげがみ〔下げ髪〕
〈名〉Hair worn hanging down the back

さけきき〔酒利き〕
〈名〉A tester (of wines):(=する) to taste wines

content:
さけくせ〔酒癖〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: さかくせ〔酒癖〕

content:
さげしお〔下げ潮〕
〈名〉The ebb-tide; low tide; low water

content.content: 今下げ潮だ
The tide is ebbing―The tide is on the ebb.
暗礁は下げ潮には見える
The rocks are visible at low tide―at low water.

さけずき〔酒好き〕
〈名〉One fond of wine; a liquorish man; a thirsty soul

content:
さげすみ〔蔑み〕
〈名〉Contempt; disdain; scorn

content.content: 蔑みを受ける
to be held in contempt―be despised

content:
さげすむ〔蔑む〕
〈他動〉To despise; to disdain; to scorn; to hold (one) in contempt; to regard (one) with contempt; to look down upon (one)

content.content: 人を食客のように蔑んでいる
They look down upon me as a sort of dependant.
こう申したらお蔑みなさるでしょう
You must despise me if I say this.

content:
さけとう〔酒党〕
〈名〉One who goes in for liquor

content.content: 君は酒党、僕は甘党
You go in for liquor―I go in for sweets.

content:
さけのみ〔酒飲み〕
〈名〉A drinker; a wine-bibber; a tippler; a thirsty soul

content.content: ありゃ大酒飲みだ
He is a heavy drinker―a drunkard―a sot―a soaker―a toper.

さけのみあいて〔酒飲み相手〕
〈名〉A boon companion; a pot-companion

さけび〔叫び〕
〈名〉A cry; a shout; a scream; a shriek; an exclamation

content:
さけびたし〔酒浸し〕
〈形〉(To be) steeped in liquor, drowned in wine

content.content: 彼は一日酒浸しになっている
He is steeped in liquor―drowned in wine―all day.

content:
さけぶ〔叫ぶ〕
〈自動〉To cry; to shout; to scream; to shriek; to exclaim

content.content: 彼に叫んで危険を警戒した
I shouted to him to warn him of the danger.
彼らは叫んで助けを求めていた
They were crying for help.
荒野に叫ぶ声
a voice crying in the wilderness
異口同音に叫んだ
They cried out in a chorus.
絹を裂くような声で叫んだ
She uttered a piercing shriek.
声を限りに叫ぶ
to scream―cry at the top of one's voice

さげふだ〔下げ札〕
〈名〉A tag; a label

さげふり〔下げ振り〕
〈名〉
1. (=時計の振子)a pendulum
2. (=錘線)a plumb-line

さげまく〔下げ幕〕
〈名〉A drop-curtain

content:
さけめ〔裂け目〕
〈名〉A rent; a rift; a rip; a split; a slit; a tear; a cleft; a crack; a fissure

content.content: 幕の裂け目
a rent in the curtain
上衣に裂目がある
There is a tear in the coat.

さげもどし〔下げ戻し〕
〈名〉The return (of an application, etc.)

さげもどす〔下げ戻す〕
〈他動〉To return (an application, etc.)

さげらんぷ〔下げランプ〕
〈名〉A hanging lamp

content:
さける〔避ける〕
〈他動〉To avoid (bad company); to avert (a calamity); to dodge, elude (a blow); to evade (an answer); to eschew (evil); to shirk (one's duty); to shun (a man); to keep off (evil); to fend off, stave off, ward off (a disaster); to keep from (war); to keep out of (danger); to fly from (temptation); to beware of (errors); to guard against (accidents); to steer clear of (rocks); to stand clear of (politics); to fight shy of (a man); to give (one) a wide berth

content.content: 悪を避けて善を為せ
Eschew evil and do good.
悪友を避けよ
Avoid bad company―Shun evil companions.
ああいう物騒な人間は避けたがよい
You ought to avoid such dangerous men―shun such dangerous men―keep clear of the gods.
彼は僕を怖がって避けている
He shuns me―keeps out of my way―fights shy of me―gives me a wide berth.
船が暗礁を避ける
A ship steers clear of rocks.
戦争を避ける
to avoid war―keep from war
危険を避ける
to keep out of danger―avoid dangers―evade dangers―avert dangers―fend off dangers―ward off dangers―steer clear of dangers
禍を避ける
to keep off evil―keep out of harm's way
災難を避ける
to avert a calamity―keep off a disaster―fend off a disaster―stave off a disaster―ward off a disaster
難を避ける
to take refuge―find refuge―take shelter―find shelter
居留民は大使館に難を避けた
The residents took refuge in the Embassy.
亡命者は日本に難を避けた
The refugee found shelter in Japan.
困難を避ける
to avoid difficulties―steer clear of difficulties
人目を避ける
to avoid observation―elude observation―shun observation
追跡を避ける、追手を避ける
to elude pursuit―evade pursuit
義務を避ける、責任を避ける
to shirk one's duty―shirk one's responsibility.
死は避くべからず
Death is not to be avoided―inevitable.
暑を避ける
to go away for the summer
箱根に暑を避ける
I go to Hakone for the summer.
寒を避ける
to go away for the winter
熱海に寒を避ける
I go to Atami for the winter.
浮世の塵を避ける
to seclude oneself from the world―hold aloof from the crowd―live remote from towns
三舎を避ける
to be put to shame
小野の小町も三舎を避けるような美人
She would shame a Komachi―put a Komachi to shame―put a Komachi to the blush.
商売人も三舎を避けるような手際だ
The performance would shame a professional―do credit to a professional.

content:
さける〔裂ける〕
〈自動〉To tear; to rend; to split; to rip

content.content: この羅紗は裂けやすい
This cloth tears easily.
食える茸は縦に裂ける
An edible mushroom splits from end to end.
縮緬は古くなるとピリピリ裂ける
Old crape is apt to rip.
帆がぼろぼろに裂けている
The sails are torn to ribbons―torn to shreds―torn to tatters―The sails hang in ribbons―hang in shreds―hang in tatters.
口が耳まで裂けている
It has a wide mouth extending from ear to ear.
胸が裂けるような思いをした
I had a heart-rending experience―I felt as if my heart would break.
彼女は胸が裂けそうに泣いた
She cried as if her heart wound break―cried fit to break her heart.
彼は喉が裂けるほど大きな声を出して叫んでいた
He was bawling fit to burst.

content:
さげる〔下げる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=低くする)to lower; to depress; to drop

content.content: 声を下げる
to lower the voice―depress the voice
値段を下げる
to lower the price―reduce the price―abate the price
位を下げる
to lower one's rank―degrade one
貨幣の位を下げる
to debase the coin
将校を兵卒に下げる
to reduce an officer to the ranks
上官の命に背いて兵卒に下げられた
He was reduced to the ranks for disobeying orders.
調子を下げる
to lower the pitch
銃口(砲口)を下げる
to depress the muzzle
利息を下げる
to lower the interest
家賃や地代を下げる
to lower the rent
程度を下げる
to lower the standard
熱を下げる
to lower the temperature―(熱病の熱なら)―allay the fever―bring down the fever
頭を下げる
to bow one's head―humble oneself―cringe
彼は人に頭を下げることが嫌いだ
He is proud.
人格を下げる
to abase one's character―(無意志なら)―derogate from one's character
そんなことをしては紳士の品格を下げる
It would be beneath the dignity of a gentleman―beneath a gentleman―to do such a thing.
男を下げる
to fall ［sink］ in the public estimation
あんなことをして男を下げた
His conduct has lowered ［sunk］ him in the public estimation.
犬が尾を下げる
A dog holds his tail down.
犬が尾を下げてこそこそ逃げた
A dog slunk off with his tail between his legs.
女に目尻を下げる
to cast eyes on―cast sheep's eyes on―a woman

content: 2. (=ぶらさげる)to hang

content.content: 髪を下げる
to hang one's hair down one's back

content: 3. (=佩用{はいよう}する)to wear

content.content: 彼は勲章を下げている
He wears a star on his breast.
軍刀を下げている
He wears a sabre by his side.

content: 4. (=下付する)to grant

content.content: 旅行免状を下げる
to grant one a passport
鑑札を下げる
to grant one a licence

content: 5. (=撤する)to remove, take away (anything)

content.content: 茶を下げろ
Remove the tea-things.
食事を下げる
to clear the table

content: 6. (=暇をやる)to dismiss, discharge (a servant)

content.content: 女中を宿へ下げよう
I will send her home.

content: 〈自動〉

content.content: 潮が下げている
The tide is ebbing―on the ebb.

content:
さげる〔提げる〕
〈他動〉To carry (anything) in one's hand; to have (anything) in one's hand

content.content: 門には巡査が角灯を提げて立っていた
A policeman stood at the door with a lantern in his hand.
あなたとならば手鍋提げても厭{いと}やせぬ
Give me love in a cottage with you!
どの面{つら}下げて来た
How can you have the face to come?

さげわたす〔下げ渡す〕
〈他動〉To grant (one a passport, etc.)

さけん〔差遣〕
〈名〉Despatch:(=する) to despatch (an official, etc.)

content:
さげん〔左舷〕
〈名〉Port

content.content: 左舷に当たって船見ゆ
A sail is in sight to port.
左舷正横に当たって
on the port beam
左舷船首の方に当たって
on the port bow
左舷船尾の方に当たって
on the port quarter
左舷開きに走る
to sail on the port tack
左舷直
port watch
舵を左舷に取る
to starboard the helm
船が左舷にかたぐ
A ship lists to port.
左舷に弾を受けた
The ship was struck on the port side.

content:
ざこ〔雑魚〕
〈名〉Small fish; fry

content.content: 雑魚汁
a fry soup

content:
さこう〔逆う〕
〈他動〉To go against (one's nature, etc.)

content.content: 忠言耳に逆う
Good words sound harsh to the ear―Truth is disagreeable.→『さからう〔逆う〕』

さこう〔鎖港〕
〈名〉Closure of ports:(=する) to close the ports

content:
さこうべん〔左顧右眄〕
〈副〉Looking to right and left:(=する) to look to right and left; to waver; to vacillate

content.content: 左顧右眄決するあたわず
He wavers in his decision―vacillates in his decision.

ざこえび〔雑魚海老〕
〈名〉The shrimp

content:
さこく〔鎖国〕
〈名〉Closure of the country; national isolation; exclusion of foreigners:(=する) to close the country; to close the doors to foreigners; to exclude foreigners

content.content: 幕府は鎖国を行った
The shogunate closed the country to foreigners.
鎖国策
exclusive policy
鎖国党
the exclusion party

content:
さこそ
〈感嘆詞〉How!; What!

content.content: さこそ歎かん不憫やな
How grieved she will be,―what will be her grief,―poor girl!
その悦びはさこそと察せらる
His joy may be imagined.

さこつ〔鎖骨〕
〈名〉The collar-bone; the clavicle

content:
ざこつ〔坐骨〕
〈名〉The huckle-bone:(=の) ischiatic; sciatic

content.content: 坐骨神経
the sciatic nerve
坐骨神経痛
sciatica―the hip-gout

ざこね〔雑魚寝〕
〈名〉Promiscuous sleeping; bundling:(=する) to sleep together without undressing; to bundle

content:
ささ〔笹〕
〈名〉
1. A small bamboo; a dwarf bamboo

content.content: 笹葉
bamboo leaves―bamboo blades

content:
2. (=縫物のささ)a gore; a gusset
3. (=酒)(another name for) wine

ささ〔瑣々〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: ささい〔些細〕

ざさ〔坐作〕
〈名〉(=坐作進退)Behaviour; deportment

content:
ささい〔些細〕
〈形〉Trifling (sum); trivial (matter); slight (mistake); petty (fault); paltry (sum); unimportant (matter); insignificant (matter); inconsiderable (loss); imperceptible (difference, etc.)

content.content: 些細なこと
a trifle―a trifling matter―a trivial matter―a triviality
こんなことは些細なことだと思う
I consider the matter of no consequence―hold the matter of no moment.
彼は些細なことで立腹する
He will take offence at trifles.
些細なことで癇癪を起こす
He will fly into a passion at trifles―on the least provocation.
そんな些細なことで怒るものでない
You should not get angry at such trifles―Do not let so slight a thing put you out!
これは些細な内証事
This is a private matter of no consequence.
彼は些細なことに拘泥する
He sticks to trifles―He is stickler for trivialities.
些細なことにも忠実だ
He is scrupulous about trifles―conscientious about trifles.
ごく些細なことまでも厳重だ
He is exact to the merest trifles.
些細な間違いまでも直さなけりゃ承知しない
He insists on correcting the slightest mistakes.
些細な過失は見て見ぬふりがよし
It is best to wink at petty faults.
彼は些細な金を貰って働いている
He works for a trifling sum―a paltry sum―a mere pittance.
些細な損亡で済んだ
I got off with a trifling loss―a trivial loss―an inconsiderable loss.
両者間には些細な差がある
There is a slight difference―an almost imperceptible difference―between the two.
利益は些細なものだ
The profits are not worth mentioning―nothing to speak of.

content:
ささえ〔支え〕
〈名〉Support; maintenance; sustenance; a prop; a stay; a staff:(=る) to support (a family); to maintain (a state); to sustain (life); to bear (the roof); to hold (a position); to keep (a family); to prop (a beam); to prop up (a tree); to bolster up (an invalid); to stay (the stomach); to check (the enemy); to stem (the tide,); to hold out

content.content: 命を支える
to support life―sustain life―subsist
彼は人様のお情けで命を支えている
He subsists on charity.
パンは命を支える
Bread is the staff of life.
体力を支える
to support nature―sustain nature
体力を支えるだけの営養がある
There is enough nutriment to sustain nature.
一家を支える
to support a family―maintain a family―sustain a family―keep a family
国家を支える
to maintain the state
敵を支える
to check the enemy―stand one's ground against the enemy
歩兵は騎兵の突貫を支える
The infantry bears the shock of a cavalry charge―sustains the shock of a cavalry charge.
軍隊が敵を支えかねて浮足になる
The troops waver―falter―begin to give way.
あの銀行はもう支えきれぬ
The bank can not hold out any longer.
大廈{たいか}のまさに倒れんとするや一木のよく支えるところにあらず
When a great house is about to fall, no single post can prevent it―(より)―No one can stay single-handed a falling Empire.

content:
さざえ〔蠑螺〕
〈名〉The turbo(複数―turbines)

content.content: 螺の壺焼
a turbo cooked in its own shell
蠑螺のような挙骨
a horny fist

content:
ささきげん〔酒機嫌〕
〈名〉Exhilaration

content.content: 彼はいつも酒機嫌だ
He is always under the exhilaration of wine―under the influence of wine.

ささくれ
〈名〉An agnail; a hang-nail

ささげ〔大角豆〕
〈名〉A kind of bean; the cow-pea

content:
ささげつつ〔捧げ銃〕
〈号令〉Present arms!

content.content: 番兵が捧げ銃をした
The sentry presented arms.

content:
ささげもの〔捧げ物〕
〈名〉An offering; a sacrifice

content.content: 捧げ物をする
to make an offering―offer a sacrifice―(to the gods)

content:
ささげる〔捧げる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=差し上げる)to lift up; to hold up

content.content: 目八分に捧げる
to hold anything above one's eyes

content: 2. (=奉呈する)to offer (sacrifices to a deity); to sacrifice (an offering to a god); to present (a sword to a general); to devote (one's life to art); to dedicate (a work to a person); to consecrate (a temple to God); to lay (anything) at one's feet

content.content: 彼は芸術に一生を捧げた
He devoted his life to art―dedicated his life to art―consecrated his life to art.
国家に身を捧げる
to offer oneself to one's country―dedicate oneself to one's country―sacrifice oneself for one's country
国家に捧げた命だ
My life is offered to my country―dedicated to my country.
国家に捧げた命だから惜しくはない
I do not cling to a life which I have offered to my country.
神に身を捧げる
to dedicate oneself to God―consecrate oneself to God
そのために生命を捧げることを厭わぬ
I am ready to offer my life―sacrifice my life―in the cause.
彼は国家のために生命を捧げた
He gave his life for his country―laid down his life for his country.
祈祷を捧げる
to offer up one's prayers―put up one's prayers
すべてのものを君に捧げる
I lay my all at your feet.
君に渾身の愛を捧げている
I love you with all my heart and soul.

content:
ささたる〔瑣々たる〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: ささい〔些細〕

ささっぱ〔笹葉〕
〈名〉Bamboo leaves; bamboo blades

content:
ささなみ〔漣〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: さざなみ〔漣〕

content:
さざなみ〔漣〕
〈名〉Ripples

content.content: 漣が立つ
The surface of the water ripples.
風が吹くと漣が立つ
The wind ripples the surface of the water―ruffles the surface of the water.
風はそよとも吹かず漣一つ立たぬ
Not a breath of air stirs the surface of the water―Not a ripple disturbs the surface of the water.

ささめく
〈自動〉To whisper; to talk in whispers; to speak under one's breath

さざめく
〈自動〉To whisper; to talk in whispers

content:
ささめごと〔ささめ言〕
〈名〉A whisper

content.content: 恋人のささめ言
lover's whispers―lovers' billing and cooing
恋人がささめ言を言う
Lovers bill and coo.
閨中のささめ言
soft nothings of the conjugal bed

content:
ささやか
〈形〉Small; little; scanty

content.content: ささやかな住居
a small dwelling
ささやかな煙を立てる
to pick up a scanty livelihood

content:
ささやく〔囁く〕
〈自動〉To whisper (in one's ear); to talk in whispers; to speak under one's breath

content.content: 二人は互いに囁き合った
They whispered to each other―Whispers passed between the two.

ささやぶ〔笹籔〕
〈名〉A bamboo bush

content:
ささら〔簓〕
〈名〉
1. A bamboo whisk
2. (=木の折れ口などのささら)slivers; splinters

content.content: 木造部に砲弾があたるとささらになる

content: 3. (=提出する)to present (one's credentials); to tender (one's resignation); to produce, bring forward (evidence); to prefer (a petition to the government); to file (a petition with the government); to send in (one's application); to hand in (one's papers); to give in (one's composition, etc.)
