content:
さしたて〔差立て〕
〈名〉Despatch:(=る) to despatch (a message); to forward (goods)

content.content: 飛脚をさし立てる
to despatch an express messenger
御註文の品本日差立て申候
Your order has been forwarded today.
差立局
the office of origin

content:
さしたる
〈形〉(Not) important; (not) particular; (not) serious

content.content: さしたる用も無い
I have no business of importance―no particular business.
さしたることではない
It is no serious matter―The matter is of no consequence.
さしたる損もあるまい
There can be no serious loss.

content:
さしぢえ〔差智慧〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: いれぢえ〔入れ智慧〕

content:
さしちがえる〔刺違える〕
〈自動〉To stab each other

content.content: 彼と刺し違えて死のうと思った
I resolved to stab him to death and then stab myself.

さしつ〔左室〕
〈名〉(=心臓の左室)The left ventricle (of the heart)

content:
さしつかえ〔差支〕
〈名〉
1. (=故障)hindrance; impediment:(=る) to be impeded; to be hindered; to be prevented (from doing something)

content.content: 今君に引かれては仕事がさし支える
If you withdraw now, the work will be hindered―(と言うよりも他動詞構文にして)―Your withdrawal will hinder the progress of the work.
今頃君に去られてはさし当たり授業にさし支える
If you leave now, the class-work will be impeded for the time―we shall have to stop class-work for the time―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Your leaving at this time of day will impede the class-work for the time being.
昨晩は何かおさし支えでしたか
Did anything prevent your coming last evening?
自分の物は煮て食おうと焼いて食おうとさし支え無かろう
Nothing can prevent my doing what I like with my own―I may do what I like with my own.
やってみるのに何のさし支えがあろうか
What can prevent my trying?

content: 2. (=妨げになること)interruption; interference; engagement; business:(=る) to be interrupted; to be interfered with; to be engaged; to be busy

content.content: 昨日はさし支えがあって来られなかった
Business prevented my coming yesterday.
いまさし支えがあって面会ができない
I am busy―engaged―just now, and can not see him―Business prevents my seeing him at this moment.
人が来たならさし支えていると言ってくれ
If any one calls, say I am engaged.
おさし支えならまた伺います
If he is engaged, I shall call again.
おさし支えの時はご遠慮無くそう仰有い
When you are engaged, do not hesitate to say so.
急にさし支えができて出席致しかねます
I can not attend the meeting owing to a sudden engagement―(他動詞構文にすれば)―A sudden engagement prevents my attending the meeting.
明日ならさし支えはありません
I shall be disengaged―free―tomorrow.
降雪のために交通がさし支えた
The snow interrupted the traffic.
遊びも好いが勤めにさし支えを生じるようではいかん
Your pleasure must not interfere with your business.

content: 3. (=異議、異存)objection

content.content: 君が去ってもさし支え無い
I have no objection to your going―I do not mind your going―You are at liberty to go―You may go.
僕が行ってもさし支え無い
I have no objection to going―I don't mind going―I will go.
僕は入費の幾分を負担してもさし支え無い
I have no objection to bearing a part of the expense―I do not mind bearing a part of the expense―I will bear part of the expense.
君はこの金を使ってもさし支え無い
I have no objection to your spending the money―I don't mind your spending the money―You are at liberty to spend the money―You may spend the money.
僕は帰ってもおさし支えありませんか
Have you no objection to my going away?―Don't you mind my going away?―May I go away?
明日は来なくともおさし支えはありませんか
Have you no objection to my staying away tomorrow?―May I stay away tomorrow?
夜学はおさし支えありませんか
Have you no objection to teaching evenings?―Don't you mind teaching evenings?―Will you teach evenings?
この本を持って行ってもおさし支えありませんか
Have you no objection to my taking the book?―Don't you mind my taking the book?―May I take away the book?
おさし支え無くば持って参ります
I will take it with me if you have no objection―if you don't mind.

content: 4. (=害)harm

content.content: 酒は少しくらい飲んでもさし支え無い
A little wine will do you no harm.
罪の無い戯れはさし支え無い
Innocent amusement will do no harm―There is no harm in innocent amusement.
手紙を開けてみてもさし支えはあるまい
There can be no harm in opening the letter.
やってみてもさし支えはあるまい
There can be no harm in trying.
金はいくらあってもさし支え無い
Any amount of money will do no harm―(と言うよりも)―One can not have too much money.
休みはいくらあってもさし支え無い
We can not have too many holidays.

content: 5. (=何にさし支える、何に困る、何に窮する)to be pressed for (time or money); to be hard up for (money); to be at a loss for (an answer, etc.)

content.content: 金にさし支えている
I am pressed for money―hard up (for money).
不意撃ちを喰って返答にさし支えた
Taken by surprise, I was at a loss for an answer.

content: 6. (=何でもさし支え無い、何でも宜しい)(anything) will do

content.content: どの本でもさし支え無い
Any book will do―Any book will serve my turn.
どちらでもさし支え無い
Either will do.
いつでもさし支え無い
Any time will do.

content: 7. (=と言ってもさし支え無い)(one) may say; (one) is justified in saying

content.content: 人は働くために生きていると言ってもさし支え無い
You may say―You are justified in saying―that man lives to work.
あの人は日本第一の学者だと言ってもさし支え無い
You may say that he is the first scholar in Japan―You may call him the greatest scholar in Japan.
日本は世界第一の国だと言ってもさし支え無いだろう
I think I may safely say that Japan is the first country on earth―I think I am justified in calling Japan the best country under the sun.
日本が東洋の英国ならば英国を西洋の日本と言ってもさし支え無かろう
One may as well call England “the Japan of the West”as call Japan “the England of East.”

content: 8. (=無くてもさし支え無い)can do without (anything)

content.content: 女中は無くてもさし支え無い
We can do without a servant―get along without a servant.
僕は案内者が無くともさし支え無い
I can do without a guide―get about without a guide.
僕がいなくともおさし支え無いでしょう
You can do without me,―get along all right without me,―can't you?

content:
さしつかわす〔差遣わす〕
〈他動〉To send; to despatch

content.content: 御用の節は店員差遣し可申候
Customers attended to at home.

content:
さしつける〔差付ける〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: つきつける〔突き付ける〕

content:
さしつまる〔差詰まる〕
〈自動〉To be reduced to extremity; to be driven to the last extremity; to be driven to one's wits' end; to be put to one's shifts; to be driven into a corner; to be cornered; to be pressed (for time or money); to be hard up (for money); to be at a loss (for an answer)

content.content: 今度こそはいよいよさし詰まった(絶体絶命)
I am fairly reduced to extremity―driven to the last extremity―driven to my wits' end.
彼は議論にさし詰まってむちゃを言い出した
When he was cornered,―driven into a corner,―he came roundly up to the statement that two and two may not always make four.
金にさし詰まった
I am pressed for money―hard up (for money).
ぐっと返答にさし詰まった
I was at a loss for an answer.
さし詰まってからは何を言っても駄目だ
It is no use talking at the last moment―at the eleventh hour.

content:
さしづめ〔差詰め〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: さしあたり〔差当たり〕

content:
さして
〈副〉(Not) particularly; (not) much; (not) very

content.content: さして大事なことでもない
The matter is of no particular importance―not very important.
酒はさして害にもならないようだ
Wine does not seem to do much harm.

content:
さして〔指して〕
〈前置詞相当〉Toward; for

content.content: 軍は都を指して進んだ
The army advanced toward―made for―the capital.
「鱶{ふか}が来た」と聞いて皆陸を指して泳いだ
At the cry of “Shark!” the swimmers made for the shore.
我が家を指して急ぎ行く
I hurry home―hasten homeward.

content:
さしでがましい〔差出がましい〕
〈形〉Forward; meddlesome; intrusive; presumptuous; impertinent; bumptious; self-assertive:(女なら)pert (girl)

content.content: さし出がましい男だ
He is too forward―impertinent.
米国の婦人はさし出がましい
American girls are self-assertive.
彼が批評などとはさし出がましい
It is presumptuous of him to criticize!
批評だなんてさし出がましいことをするな
Do not presume to criticize!
さし出がましいことを言うものじゃない
You should not make impertinent remarks―not make uncalled-for remarks―refrain from uncalled-for remarks―keep your remarks till they are called for―“keep your breath to cool your porridge.”
さし出がましい振る舞いをするものじゃない
You should not put yourself forward―You should know your station.
さし出がましいようですがお止めになった方が好くはありませんか
Excuse my meddling―Excuse my interference,―Excuse my intrusion,―but hadn't you better desist?

content:
さしでぐち〔差出口〕
〈名〉An impertinent remark; an uncalled-for remark; interference

content.content: さし出口をする
to make an impertinent remark―make an uncalled-for remark―interfere―put in one's oar―shove in one's oar―poke one's nose into anything―thrust one's nose into anything
彼は何へでもさし出口をする
He interferes in everything―pokes his nose into everything.
さし出口をするな
Do not make impertinent remarks―Refrain form uncalled-for remarks―Keep your remarks till they are called for―“Keep your breath to cool your porridge.”

さしでもの〔差出者〕
〈名〉An impertinent fellow:(女なら)a pert girl

content:
さしでる〔差出る〕
〈自動〉To put oneself forward; to presume (to do anything above one's station); to interfere (in a matter); to intrude (into a society):(形容詞をもって表せば)to be forward, impertinent, presumptuous, meddlesome, intrusive, bumptious, self-assertive

content.content: あれはさし出る男だ
He is too forward―impertinent.
米国の婦人はさし出る
American girls are self-assertive.
さし出るものじゃない
You should not put yourself forward―You should know your station.
さし出たことを言うな
Do not make impertinent remarks―Refrain from uncalled-for remarks―Keep your remarks till they are called for―“Keep your breath to cool your porridge.”
批評だなんてさし出たことをするな
Do not presume to criticize!
あの男は何へでもさし出る
He interferes in everything―pokes his nose into everything.

content:
さしとおす〔刺し通す〕
〈他動〉To pierce; to run (one) through (with a sword); to thrust (one) through (with a bayonet); to transfix (one to the ground); to pin (one to the wall)

content.content: 刀で身体を刺し通す
to run one through
彼は刀を刺し通されて倒れた
He was run through and fell.
柄も通れと短刀を刺し通す
to thrust a dagger home

content:
さしとめ〔差止め〕
〈名〉
1. (=禁止)prohibition:(=る) to prohibit (drinking―one from doing something); to forbid (one to do something); to place (anything) under the ban; to place a ban on (anything)

content.content: 出入を差止める
I forbid you the house.
出入を差止められた
I have been forbidden the house.
今年は花見の仮装が差止められた
Fancy dresses for cherry parties are prohibited―under the ban―this year.
彼は辞職を差止められた
He was not permitted to resign.

content: 2. (=停止)suspension:(=る) to suspend

content.content: 新聞の発行を差止める
to suspend the publication of a newspaper
通行が差止められた
Traffic was suspended.

content:
さしね〔指値〕
〈名〉The limits (of prices)

content.content: お指し値にては株券手に入り不申候
The shares are not to be had at your limits.
お指し値以内にてかなりの品有之候
We have met with a fair lot within your limits.
お指し値の上二円以内にてはご註文に応じ兼ね候
Your order can not be executed within two yen of your limits.
指し値を超過せざるよう御注意下され度候
Your will be careful not to exceed our limits.
お指し値をお増し下さるよう願上候
I beg you will extend your limits.
指し値注文
a limited order

content:
さしはさむ〔差挟む〕
〈他動〉
1. (=挟む)to insert (a leaf in a book―paper between the leaves); to put (a finger) between (the leaves of a book); to hold (anything) between (two sticks); to interpose (the hand between the light and the eye)

content.content: 両軍は河をさし挟んで相い対した
The two armies faced each other with the river between them―The two armies faced each other across the river.
前後よりさし挟んで敵を撃った
We had the enemy between two fires.

content: 2. (=懐く)to harbour

content.content: 疑いをさし挟む
to harbour doubts―have one's doubts―suggest a doubt―(about anything)
彼は異図をさし挟んでいるやの疑いがある
He is suspected of harbouring rebellious designs.

content: 3. (=言葉をさし挟む)to put in, interpose (a word)

content.content: 「どっこいそう安くは問屋で卸さぬ」と言葉をさし挟んだ
“Not so fast!”I put in.
異議をさし挟む
to interpose an objection―raise an objection

content:
さしひかえる〔差控える〕
〈自他動〉To desist from, abstain from, refrain from, keep from (doing anything); to forbear (doing anything); to withhold, hold, stay (some activity); to reserve (one's views); to hold back, hang back

content.content: 相場が下がりそうなので買手がさし控えている
The price shows a downward tendency, and the buyers hold back―hang back.
そんな冒険な事業はさし控えた方がよくはないか
Hadn't you better desist from such risky enterprises?
僕は憤然席を蹴って去ろうと思ったが長者の手前さし控えた
I thought of flinging away in a rage, but I desisted out of regard for my superiors.
僕は言いたいことを言わずにさし控えている
I refrain from speaking my mind.
言おう言おうと思いながら遠慮してさし控えておりました
I often thought of telling you, but I have refrained from doing so out of regard for your feelings.
好い機会のあるまで意見を述べるのをさし控えておこう
I will reserve my views till some fitting opportunity.
罰が怖いので悪事をさし控える者がある
The fear of punishment deters some people from crime.

content:
さしひき〔差引き〕
〈名〉
1. (=差引くこと)deduction; subduction; allowance; discount:(=する) to deduct, subduct, subduce (one sum from another); to allow for (accidents); to discount (a story, etc.)

content.content: この金は月給から差引きして戴きたい
I wish to have this sum deducted from my salary―Please deduct this sum from my salary.
頂戴する分を差引きするといくらさし上げればよいのですか
Deducting what you owe me from what I owe you, what must I pay you?
破損を差引きするといくつ残るだろうか
If we allow for breakage,―make allowance for breakage,―how many will there be left?
かえらない卵を差引きしても八十羽はかえる
Allowing for accidents, we shall have 80 chickens.
この話は差引きして聞かなけりゃならぬ
The story must be discounted―taken with some allowance―(をしゃれて)―taken with a grain of salt―taken with some grains of allowance.

content: 2. (=差引勘定)balance:(=する) to balance (an account―the profit against the loss); to set off (the gain against the loss)

content.content: 差引残
a balance
差引残はいくらになるか
What is the balance?
差引残額は二百五十円
The balance is 250 yen.
差引残無し
The balance is even.
差引勘定する
to balance an account―strike a balance
差引き僕の貸しになる
The balance is in my favour―on my side.
差引き君の借りになる
The balance is against you.
差引き千円の利益になる
The balance is 1,000 yen to the good.
差引き五百円の損になる
The balance is 500 yen to the bad.
損益を差引きする
to balance the gain against the loss―balance the gain and loss
収支を差引きすると多少利益があるか
If we balance the receipts against the expenses,―balance the receipts and expenses,―is there any profit left?
彼の長所短所を差引きすると長所の方が勝っているか負けているか
If you balance his merits against his faults,―set off his merits against his faults,―is the balance in his favour or against him?

content: 3. (=潮の差引き)ebb and flow:(=する) to ebb and flow

content.content: 潮は差引きする
The tide ebbs and flows.
潮の差引きは月の引力に依る
The ebb and flow of the tide is caused by the gravitation of the moon.

content: 4. (=熱の差引き)rise and fall; intermittence:(=する) to rise and fall; to be intermittent

content.content: この熱は差引きする
The fever rises and falls―The fever is intermittent.

content:
さしひきかんじょう〔差引勘定〕
〈名〉Balance; striking a balance:(=する) to balance an account; to strike a balance; to balance the gain against the loss; to balance the profit and loss

content.content: 差引勘定するとこちらの得だ
The balance is in my favour.
差引勘定をするとこちらが損だ
The balance is against me.
差引勘定をすると百円の利益だ
The balance is 100 yen to the good.
差引勘定をすると五十円の損だ
The balance is 50 yen to the bad.

content:
さしひく〔差引く〕
〈他動〉
1. To deduct, subduct, subduce (one sum from another); to stop (a sum out of one's salary); to allow for (accidents); to discount (a story)

content.content: この金は俸給から差引いて戴きたい
I wish to have this sum deducted from my salary―Please deduct this sum from my salary―Please stop this sum out of my salary.
頂戴する分を差引くといくらさし上げればよいのですか
Deducting what you owe me from what I owe you; what must I pay you?
破損を差引くといくつ残るだろうか
If we allow for breakage,―make allowance for breakage,―how many will there be left?
破損を差引いて五十は無事に到着する
Allowing for breakage, fifty will arrive in good condition.
かえらない卵を差引いて八十羽はかえる
Allowing for accidents, we shall have 80 chickens.
この話は少し差引いて聞かなけりゃならぬ
The story must be discounted―taken with some allowance―(をしゃれて言うと)―taken with a grain of salt―taken with some grains of allowance.

content: 2. (=差引勘定する)to balance an account; to strike a balance

content.content: 損益を差引く
to balance the gain against the loss―balance the profit and loss
収支を差引くと多少利益があるか
If we balance the receipts against the expenses,―balance the receipts and expenses,―is there any profit left?
損益を差引くと利益になる(損になる)
The balance is in our favour―against us.
損益を差引くと千円の利益になる(千円の損になる)
The balance is 1,000 yen to the good―1,000 yen to the bad.
彼の長所短所を差引くと長所の方が勝っている、長所の方が負けている
If we balance his merits against his faults,―set off his merits against his faults,―the balance is in his favour―the balance is against him.

content:
さしひびき〔差響き〕
〈名〉Effect; influence

content.content: 地震は天候にさし響きがあるものか
Have earthquakes any influence on the weather?
天候は米価にさし響きがある
The weather has effect on the price of rice―The weather affects the price of rice.
これくらいのキズがあっても価には何のさし響きも無い
So slight a blemish does not affect the price of the article.

content:
さしひびく〔差響く〕
〈他動〉To affect; to influence

content.content: 天候は米価にさし響く
The weather affects the price of rice.
悪い手本を示すと全校にさし響く
A bad example will influence the whole school.
先生が怠けると学校の繁栄にさし響く
If the teachers neglect their duties, it will affect the prosperity of the school―the school will suffer.

さしまねく〔麾く〕
〈他動〉
1. (=手招く)to beckon to (a person)
2. (=指揮する)to command (troops)

content:
さしまわす〔差廻す〕
〈他動〉To send round

content.content: 宮内省から馬車をさしまわされた
A carriage was sent for him from the Imperial Household.

content:
さしみ〔刺身〕
〈名〉Sliced raw fish

content.content: 刺身を作る
to slice raw fish
この魚は刺身にして食う
This fish is eaten raw.
この魚は刺身が好い
I like this fish raw―This fish is best eaten raw.

さしみぼうちょう〔刺身庖丁〕
〈名〉A fish-slice

content:
さしむかい〔差向い〕
〈名〉A t?te-?-t?te:(=で) t?te-?-t?te; vis-?-vis; (two) by themselves; (two) alone

content.content: 二人はさし向いで内証話しをしていた
They were having a t?te-?-t?te.
二人はさし向いで飲んでおった
The lovers were drinking by themselves.
さし向いになると彼は問わず語りを始めた
When we were alone, he began his confidences.
あの方とさし向いになったことはありません
We have never been alone together.
夫婦さし向いで暮らしている
The couple live by themselves.

content:
さしむき〔差向き〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: さしあたり〔差当たり〕

content:
さしむける〔差向ける〕
〈他動〉To send, direct, refer (one person to another)

content.content: 執達吏をさし向けられた
A bailiff was sent to me.
追討軍をさし向ける
to send a punitive force against the rebels
なお詳しいことは幹事に聞けと言ってさし向けてやった
I referred him to my secretary for further particulars.

content:
さしも
〈副〉(Such) as (it is); so

content.content: さしもの幕府も一朝にして瓦解した
Powerful as the Shogunate was, it collapsed in a day.
さしもの勇士もこの悪口には辟易した
Brave man as he was, he winced under this calumny.
さしも広い公園も人でいっぱいになった
So large a park was packed close with people.
